[[Callie Torres]] Arizona is a lesbian and was married to [[Callie Torres]].[[File:Callie&Arizona.jpg|thumb|Callie and Arizona]] At the [[Emerald City Bar]], she saw that Callie was upset and came to comfort her in the bathroom and kissed her. Callie soon decided to ask her out, but Arizona declined the offer after finding out [[Erica Hahn|Erica]] was Callie's first girlfriend. Her reasons were metaphorical: she deals mostly with newborns at work; she does not want to deal with them in her personal life, but she claimed "[she is] super flattered. Super." at the offer. Annoyed, Callie confronted her, but the situation was made more awkward after she discovered that Arizona was on a date with a woman named [[Julie]]. Callie started to avoid her, but she was eventually cornered in the elevator. Arizona then decided to explain that sometimes she doesn't always make the right choice under pressure and that she was wrong. Callie accepted it and Arizona asked her out again and after pretending not to be interested for a few seconds, Callie accepted. Their relationship continued, but when Callie's father came to visit and discovered that she was dating a girl, he cut Callie off. Mark and Cristina both suggested that she lie and say she broke up with Arizona, but after Arizona approached her and told her that she loved how Callie cared so much about things and wouldn't care if Callie lied, Callie decided not to lie because her family should accept her. However, Callie began to withdraw slightly and began to avoid Arizona. Arizona then asked if their relationship was just a fling and it had run its course and Callie told her that it probably was. Arizona later approached Callie and Callie told her the real reason was because she didn't have the money for four-star restaurants anymore but Arizona told her that they could stay in and eat sandwiches. Callie countered that neither of them liked sandwiches, so they settled on pizza instead. The relationship was threatened again when Callie got annoyed at Arizona for believing that George joining the army was awesome, but after hearing that Arizona's brother died in the war, she apologized. On Arizona's birthday, after a failed surprise party, Arizona told Callie she loved her, and Callie reciprocated her feelings. Callie was dismayed to learn that Arizona didn't want children. She assumed that Arizona's reluctance was related to her brother's death, but Arizona told her she simply liked her life the way it was. They came to the conclusion that they could not continue their relationship, as they both wanted different things. However, after a shooter entered Seattle Grace with a vendetta for Derek, Lexie, and Richard, they were in lockdown together, and eventually decided to get back together and have kids. They passionately kissed in happiness. Six months after the shooting, Arizona received word that she had been given the Carter Maddison Grant, and was allowed to go to Malawi and become a doctor there. She had applied for this grant two years previously, when she hadn't met Callie yet. After some hesitation, Arizona decided to accept the grant. In the end, Callie was shown to have accepted this as well and decided to leave with Arizona. However, a fight at the airport resulted in Arizona leaving for Africa without Callie. After some time passed, Arizona came back and told Callie she missed her, but Callie closed the door in her face. Callie continued to reject Arizona's constant pleading and apologies. Eventually, Callie revealed that she was pregnant with Mark's baby. After asking for time to process, Arizona accepted the situation, and she and Callie restarted their relationship. Callie and Arizona later reconciled and they moved back in together. After seeing the baby's heartbeat for the first time, Arizona referred to the baby as "theirs." However, tensions continued with Mark in the picture as an active and interested father. Callie gifted Arizona with a weekend getaway, but continued communicating with Mark as she and Arizona drove. Arizona's jealousy came to the forefront, and the two argued, with Callie concluding, "Tell me what you want and I'll do it." After a pause, Arizona said, "Marry me." They had shocked faces as they approached a stopped truck and crashed. Arizona was slightly battered, but Callie (who'd taken off her seatbelt) flew through the windshield. A series of surgeries followed (including the delivery of [[Sofia Robbin Sloan Torres|her very premature baby]]) along with emotional breakdowns by both Mark and Arizona. Callie eventually woke up and turned to Arizona, who was sitting at her bedside, and whispered, "Yes, I'll marry you." They finally married at a ceremony officiated by [[Miranda Bailey]]. The plane crash put a strain on their relationship. Arizona made Callie promise that she would not cut her leg off and Callie agreed. However, Arizona had an infection in her leg that she could have died from if she didn't cut off the leg. Because Callie broke the promise, Arizona began to ignore her. Finally, as she regained her strength and confidence when she learned to use her prosthetic. Arizona even became pregnant with a sperm donor's child but miscarried. Their relationship took a turn for the better until Arizona slept with Lauren Boswell during the superstorm, and Callie found out. Callie and Arizona were separated until after Callie's trial when Callie asked Arizona to move back in. After Arizona cheats on [[Callie Torres]] with [[Lauren Boswell]] during the superstorm. When Callie finds out she is furious she ends up kicking her out of the house. After being kicked out Callie and Arizona both agree couples therapy would be the best option. In the end, Arizona and Callie end up divorcing. [[Lauren Boswell]] Dr. Lauren Boswell came to GSM to perform a surgery on an infant with his brain growing on the outside of his head. She was very flirtatious with Arizona, who happily flirted back. They would joke about how they looked at each other up on the internet and knew all about each other. At the start of the [[Readiness is All|superstorm]], she asked for Arizona to show her to an on-call room to rest in. Arizona obliged and took her there. They said their goodbyes and Arizona extended her arm for a handshake. Lauren simply laughed and they hugged. The lights flickered off from the superstorm as they started kissing. As the lights flickered back on, Arizona pushed her off, saying that she couldn't do that. Arizona almost left and Lauren said, "Arizona, you are allowed to lose a little bit of control." Arizona pondered the thought for a moment and ended up locking the door instead of opening it. She returned to Lauren and kissed her while she pulled off Lauren's lab coat. The two of them had sex and accidentally exchanged scrub tops, which is how Callie noticed later that Arizona had cheated on her. [[Leah Murphy]] On the night of the fundraising gala, Arizona Robbins and [[April Kepner]] bonded over drinks in the hospital storage closet. Since they were too intoxicated to drive, Leah called them a cab.[[Puttin' on the Ritz]], x Shortly thereafter, Leah called to make sure the girls arrived home safely and ended up visiting Arizona at her apartment. The two watched movies and talked all night (though Arizona remembered none of it). Worried about what took place that night, Arizona asked Leah if anything happened between them and Leah told her nothing had. However, the two ended up making out on a different occasion, causing Leah to become somewhat obsessed with Arizona (much like she did with Alex). Arizona rebuffed her obsession and ended things. Leah told Arizona that she respected her so much and the thought of Arizona thinking about her in that way made her feel amazing. That night Arizona texted Leah asking 'What are you up to?' implying that she wanted her to come over. The two of them ended up sharing a kiss. On the morning of Halloween, Leah wakes up in Arizona's hotel bed. She gets ready to leave, waking up Arizona, Arizona says that she doesn't have to leave. Leah says she knows she's not supposed to sleep over and apologizes, but Arizona says it's okay. Leah thinks it's not, as she's all about easy. At the hospital, Leah gets bit in the neck by a drug addict and is tested for HIV. Arizona helped calm her worry. She told Leah a similar story to reach out to her.[[Thriller]], x The two of them continued to see each other sexually until Callie asked Arizona to move back in. [[Eliza Minnick]] When a new consultant was hired by Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital to revamp their surgical residency program, Eliza made a loud entrance. When Eliza was in the elevator on her way to Bailey's office, Arizona walked by and asked if she needed help. Eliza answered that she forgot where chief Bailey had her office. Arizona then mentioned that Eliza had made a big mistake leaving Arizona's name off the list of good teachers. Eliza insisted that the list was only made to help her remember everyone's names. Arizona wondered why Eliza would not have to learn her name. Eliza then answered, "That name attached to that face? That's not one you forget." On Eliza's first day at Grey Sloan, Eliza helped out where she was needed. She then ended up helping Arizona, during which she flirted. Arizona played it cool and acted like she didn't remember their conversation by the elevator. They later agreed to get drinks. However, after Arizona travelled to a prison hospital with Bailey and Jo, and then returned to work on Eliza's official first day, she blew Eliza off, stating that she was too tired. Eliza told her that she only wanted to compliment her on implementing her new teaching method, by allowing Leah to intubate the baby unsupervised. Arizona was later annoyed when Eliza moved one of her surgeries, and accused Eliza of turning everybody against her, but Eliza defended herself by saying that people were simply afraid of change. Arizona blamed Eliza for having Meredith suspended, which surprised Eliza, who was unaware of Meredith's suspension. Later, Arizona was confronted by Eliza in the parking lot, with Eliza claiming while Arizona was acting as though she was against her, she was really afraid of Eliza being fired, as that would mean the pair could pursue a relationship. When Eliza forgot to alert the authorities that Stephanie went missing during the hospital lockdown and explosion, Bailey fired her. When Arizona found her and asked if they could have sex, Eliza said she needed to pack her things since she was fired, leaving Arizona speechless. Arizona then tried to give her some space, but later found out Eliza had left town without saying goodbye, effectively ghosting Arizona. [[Carina DeLuca]] She met Carina at a bar. She ended up bringing her home and the two had sex. Even after Andrew came home and interrupted the events, they continued. The next day, when Arizona found out that Carina was at the hospital doing research, she went to see her and Carina continued her flirting. Arizona described the sex the two of them had as pain-relieving. After learning that Sofia was coming back home, Arizona inadvertently broke things off with Carina. After not seeing Arizona for a few days, Carina asked her if she was okay. Arizona said she'd taken a few days off after Karin Taylor's death. Arizona was shocked to learn Carina had never lost a mom, while Carina was shocked to learn Arizona had lost more than one. That inspired Arizona to look into it as a surgical project and once she had written up a proposal, she asked Carina to work on it with her, a decision they sealed with a kiss. After Carina made a comment about moving countries at the drop of a hat, Arizona asked her if she was just going to leave suddenly and end their relationship. Carina said that she had no plans to leave or end their relationship. When Arizona decided she needed to move herself and Sofia back to New York, she ended things with Carina. [[Miranda Bailey]] When Arizona first worked with Bailey after her arrival at Seattle Grace Hospital, they butted heads when they disagreed over the treatment plan Arizona's predecessor had set for [[Jackson Prescott]], which Bailey had supported. Bailey complained to Richard about Arizona, but he simply told her to work with Arizona because that's who they had. Despite this, Arizona quickly saw Bailey's potential as a pediatric surgeon, claiming she was "uniquely qualified," and supporting her in her decision to apply for a spot in pediatric surgery. When Arizona gave her notice to Chief Bailey in anticipation of moving to New York, Bailey said when she had first met Arizona, she had thought Arizona was a pixie stick, an empty vessel, full of sugar, who skated in a hospital and didn't know then that it would be one of the great privileges of her life to know her and to work with her.[[Cold as Ice]], x [[Teddy Altman]] On her first day at the hospital, the only person Teddy knew was Owen. They joined Arizona, Mark, and Callie in the cafeteria. After lunch, Teddy and Arizona walked to the ER together. Jackson and Cristina were waiting for Arizona, because their patient was a boy with asthma. Teddy did a little exam and found that the boy had cardiac asthma. She asked for an OR, but Cristina, who had been questioning Teddy's abilities all day, was reluctant. Teddy then made it clear to Cristina that she had to what she said, and left. Arizona smilingly commented that she really liked Teddy. Later, when Arizona noticed Teddy staring mooningly at Owen, Arizona declared that the two of them were going to be friends, going so far as to claim that, "I'm an awesome friend." She suggested that they do a ladies' night. When [[Mark Sloan|Mark]] asked Teddy out, Teddy confided in Arizona, who suggested that Mark was like candy: eat it and forget about it. When things sparked between Mark and Teddy, Arizona was again the one she confided in. When Arizona went to Africa, she and Teddy continued to keep in touch and regularly wrote to each other. When [[Callie Torres|Callie]] became pregnant and asked Arizona to be in, Arizona went to Teddy for advice on whether or not to be in. Arizona arranged ladies night for her after Henry died. Arizona and Teddy continued to keep in touch after Teddy moved to Germany, as Arizona learned about Owen double-dipping from her phone conversation with Teddy. [[April Kepner]] After seeing Callie at the [[Puttin' on the Ritz|fundraising gala]], Arizona escaped back to the hospital, where she hid in a supply closet to cry. April found her there and offered comfort, but Arizona kindly sent her away. However, at the party, April overheard Callie tell everyone that Arizona died in the plane crash they were in. Furious at this, she took two bottles of champagne and met Arizona in the hospital storage closet where she was hiding to share a drink and talk. They soon became very open with each other and discussed their relationship problems together, bonding them. April later stood up for Arizona against Callie when Callie mentioned wanting to move back into [[Callie and Arizona's Apartment|their apartment]]. She reminded Callie that Arizona needs the elevator and that it's already retrofitted to be accessible for her. [[Richard Webber]] Richard and Arizona's relationship started out as a complicated professional one, mainly due to Arizona's authority issues, which would result in her crying whenever the Chief opposed or intimidated her. However, she outgrew those authority issues and they eventually became good friends. Richard accompanied Arizona to a lesbian bar as her wingman and became her go-to person for dating troubles. He was also the one who supported her most during the custody battle and convinced her not to give up. [[Mark Sloan]] After becoming Callie's girlfriend, Arizona also became good enough friends with Mark, Lexie, and Cristina. When she returned from Malawi, she asked Callie for a second chance. Callie then revealed that she was pregnant and that Mark was the father. Although initially she was not happy about this development, she decided she was in. However, she developed some resentment towards Mark, which would come to a head after her and Callie\us car crash. Eventually, both Arizona and Mark made up and together with Callie, the three raised Sofia together until Mark's death. When Callie was pregnant Mark and Arizona took an interest in her health and started cooking and trying new recipes together.[[P.Y.T. (Pretty Young Thing)]], x [[Alex Karev]] Alex Karev and Arizona Robbins started out with a rocky relationship when they first met. But as time went on, Karev realized that Arizona was one of the few people who actually believed in him. Arizona Robbins saw Karev as a promising peds surgeon who was dedicated despite his temper and personal issues and continued to maintain a good mentor-student relationship with him until the end of Alex's residency. Karev's decision to leave [[Seattle]] to take the fellowship offer at [[Johns Hopkins Hospital|Hopkins]] led her to take his place on a plane that ended up crashing. While she was in the hospital trying to fight the infection in her leg, she mentioned that she was still very much "pissed off" and stated that she felt as though Karev should have been in the crash rather than herself, because she spent the whole time thinking about her wife and her baby and he had no wife and no baby; he had no one. When she returned to work, she and Alex maintained their friendship and working relationship with Alex looking out for her. She was unaware that Alex was the surgeon who cut off her leg until years later. Callie didn't tell her because she knew Arizona would hate her and she wanted her to have someone to lean on. When she did find out, she thanked Alex for telling her.[[One Flight Down]], x While working together with Alex on two equally sick twins and they had to decide which one would get the donor liver they both needed, Arizona had a moment of looking back on her relationship with Alex. The situation reminded Arizona about their first case together and she shared that she was very proud of him and that she trusted him to handle this case well.[[I Choose You]], x [[Nicole Herman]] Before Arizona undertook Nicole's fetal surgery fellowship, they seemed to have a close professional relationship, with Nicole often teasing Arizona about how fetal surgery was more difficult than pediatric surgery. As they began to work together more frequently, they got closer and became less hostile towards each other. They both often jointly spent several nights at the hospital, even going to great lengths as to steal the attendings' lounge sofa together, to continue working on Arizona's crash course. Arizona reached out to Nicole once when Nicole attended "Blind School," but Nicole didn't pick up or call back, leaving Arizona to give up trying to initiate contact. They made up when Nicole returned to Grey Sloan and offered her money to open a center for women's health together.[[Cold as Ice]], x Others Arizona initially got off on the wrong foot with Dr. Bailey and Karev. Alex couldn't understand how she could be so perky after harvesting organs from a young child. When Dr. Kenley died Dr. Bailey took offense to Arizona changing [[Jackson Prescott|Jackson Prescott's]] course of treatment and proceeded to complain to the Chief and call her an "infant". However, Bailey soon realized that Arizona is a competent doctor and grew closer to her after applying for a peds fellowship. [[File:x-.jpg|thumb|left|px|Dr. Robbins at work.]] Following the death of [[Jordan Kenley|Dr. Jordan Kenley]], Dr. Robbins was appointed as [[Attending#Department Head|Head]] of [[Pediatric Surgery]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. She was top of her class and she was the [[Resident#Chief Resident|chief resident]] in her fifth year at [[Johns Hopkins Hospital]]. She then completed her pediatric surgical [[Fellow|fellowship]] at Seattle Grace Hospital. When Bailey and Robbins first worked together, Richard said to Bailey that "She's the best that anyone's seen in a long time, just like you are". She is also on a first name basis with the Head of Pediatric Surgery at Johns Hopkins, as she studied under him during her residency. When Arizona won a grant to advance pediatric surgery in less developed countries, she gave her notice and resigned. Later, she returns to Seattle Grace as an attending under [[Robert Stark|Dr. Robert Stark]], the interim Head of Pediatric Surgery. A year later, Arizona resumes her position as the head pediatric surgeon. She is very much aware of the nature of her job, Robbins has seen things in pediatric surgery to the extent she has nightmares about the tiny coffins that her patients will be buried in, and so she will remain optimistic in the face of the tragedy involved in her job. Her optimism and child-friendly abilities can be seen frequently and are also shown as she has cute animals on her lab coat; what appears to be a monkey or a lion above the Seattle Grace logo on the right hand side of her lab coat and a cat above her name and title on the left hand side; and she even wears Heelys at work, heeling around the hospital. When Cristina Yang was put on her service she made Cristina attach a small toy bear, Mr. Bear, to her lab coat and made sure she knew that pediatric surgery was not general surgery in miniature and that Cristina had to like children. At the beginning of the [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|- residency year]], Arizona decided to start a [[Fetal Surgery|fetal surgery]] [[Fellow|fellowship]] under [[Nicole Herman|Dr. Nicole Herman]]. Because of brain tumor, Nicole is very harsh on Arizona, as she wants to teach Arizona years worth of fetal surgery knowledge within the six months she has left. She managed to teach Arizona everything from the one-year fellowship in less than half the time, thus making Arizona officially an attending fetal surgeon. When Herman was blind after her tumor resection, Arizona took over being head of fetal surgery. *Arizona wears a Holly Hobbie scrub cap. *Arizona likes pizza. *She drives a red Volvo S *Arizona dislikes sandwiches. *Arizona thinks that Sudoku is boring.[[She's Gone]], x *Prior to her left leg being amputated above the knee, she often wore wheeled sneakers at work. *When confronting someone who commands respect and authority, such as [[Daniel Robbins|her father]] or [[Richard Webber|Chief Webber]], she often used to break down and cry, but she seems to have gotten over it throughout the years. *When under pressure and in trouble, Arizona smokes cigarettes.[[Goodbye]], x *Arizona regularly treats patients under the table because she finds it hard to say no to parents of sick babies. *When her [[Timothy Robbins|brother]] died, she grieved by eating donuts and crying. *When Callie had the chicken pox, Arizona snooped through [[Lexie Grey|Lexie]]'s personnel file to see if she had been vaccinated against the chicken pox, which she had, so she put Lexie in charge of Callie's case. *She dislikes pumpkin scones. *She went to Malawi after winning a grant. However, this was a dangerous place for her to be as Malawi had strict anti-homosexuality laws at that time. Had she been discovered to be a lesbian, she could have faced up to years of hard labor if convicted. *Arizona's left leg was amputated above the knee following her being in a plane crash.[[Flight]], x *[[Sofia Robbin Sloan Torres|Sofia]] calls her Mommy. *Arizona refers to her patients as tiny humans and to their parents as tiny human makers. *She and former patient [[Wallace Anderson]] share the same birthday.[[Invest in Love]], x *She hates camping. *She is the first known attending to have been the Head of two different departments, in this case Pediatric Surgery and Fetal Surgery. *During Arizona's third year as a med student, doing an [[Internal Medicine|internal medicine]] [[Clerkship|rotation]], she experienced an HIV-scare due to an incorrect needle retraction while working on an end-stage AIDS patient. *When she and [[Callie Torres|Callie]] decided to get pregnant, Arizona started making a list of terrible baby names, which included Raynbow, Bubba, Tulio, Agamemnon, Zamboni, Hashtag, and Digger. Since Callie didn't want any of the cute baby names she wanted, her plan was to bury them in a sea of terrible ones.[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]], x *She used to be a fan of punk rock. She stated that she "rocked the heavy eyeliner and had some t-shirts".[[Don't Dream It's Over]], x *Her phone number is [[Tel:()--|()--]].[[Sledgehammer]], x *[[Stephanie Edwards|Stephanie]] confirmed that Arizona took over [[Nicole Herman|Herman's]] job as head of [[Fetal Surgery|fetal surgery]] in [[Sledgehammer]], which was reiterated during a separate conversation in [[Walking Tall]]. However during that conversation, it wasn't mentioned that she was still head of [[Pediatric Surgery|peds surgery]]. *Arizona is one of the "Grey Sloan Seven". *Arizona is one of the "Seattle Grace Five". *Arizona doesn't like Trivia.[[Something Against You]], x *When Arizona talked about her dating pool to Richard, she called them by their notable characteristics, such as "Artisanal Soap". *She's never been fired.[[Break Down the House]], x *Ann was her favorite scrub nurse until she was laid off as part of the pre-merger cutbacks.[[Tainted Obligation]], x *She hates flying.[[Sympathy for the Devil]], x ArizonaRobbins.png xArizonaRobbins.png xArizonaRobbins.png xArizonaRobbins.png {{GalleryLink}} These episodes are Arizona-centric or are otherwise very informative about her life. *[[Wish You Were Here]] *[[Beat Your Heart Out]] *[[Invasion]] *[[Invest in Love]] *[[Song Beneath the Song]] *[[White Wedding]] *[[Let the Bad Times Roll]] *[[Migration]] *[[Flight]] *[[Remember the Time]] *[[I Saw Her Standing There]] *[[I Was Made for Lovin' You]] *[[Walking on a Dream]] *[[Idle Hands]] *[[Sorry Seems to Be the Hardest Word]] *[[Throwing it All Away]] *[[Bend & Break]] *[[Staring at the End]] *[[The Distance]] *[[Odd Man Out]] *[[Mama Tried]] *[[You Can Look (But You'd Better Not Touch)]] *[[All of Me]] :'''Arizona (to [[Carlos Torres|Carlos]]):''' Most people think I was named for the state, but it's not true. I was named for a battleship, the U.S.S. Arizona. My grandfather was serving on the Arizona when the Japanese bombed Pearl Harbor, and he saved men before he drowned. Pretty much everything my father did his whole life was about honoring that sacrifice. I was raised to be a good man in a storm. Raised to love my country, love my family, protect the things I love. When my father, Colonel Daniel Robbins of the United States Marine Corps heard that I was a lesbian, he said he had only one question. I was prepared for, "How fast can you get the hell out of my house?" But instead, it was, "Are you still who I raised you to be?" My father believed in country the way that you believe in God. And my father is not a man who bends, but he bent for me because I'm his daughter. I'm a good man in a storm. I love your daughter, and I protect the things that I love. Not that I need to. She doesn't need it. She's strong, and caring, and honorable. And she's who you raised her to be.[[Invasion]], x ---- :'''Arizona (to [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]]):''' This is not general surgery in miniature. These are the tiny humans. These are children. They believe in magic. They play pretend. There is fairy dust in their IV bags. They hope, and they cross their fingers, and they make wishes, and that makes them more resilient than adults. They recover faster, survive worse. They believe.[[Invest in Love]], x ---- :'''Arizona (to [[Dr. Dreyfuss]]):''' Really? Really?! You think that we need to just get off our asses? We should do you that solid because the loss of our colleague and friend is all about your needs, your schedule? You think that we should be sensitive to that? How about you take a minute to think about the person, the talent, the life that we lost?! How about you think before you start complaining that Derek Shepherd's death has been inconvenient for you?![[She's Leaving Home]], x ---- :'''Arizona (to [[Nathan Riggs|Nathan]]):''' It's just that Derek was epic for her. They were the great love story. I mean, that girl's heart beat for Derek Shepherd. It's just never occurred to me that she would ever be with anyone else. He was perfect. He was everything. I mean, that man turned her world.[[What's Inside]], x {{Arizona Robbins Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[de:Arizona Robbins]] [[fr:Arizona Robbins]] [[es:Arizona Robbins]] [[it:Arizona Robbins]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Robbins, Arizona}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (ER)]] [[Category:Patients (OB/GYN)]] [[Category:Patients (Ortho)]] [[Category:Patients (Prosthesis)]] [[Category:Patients (Psych)]] [[Category:Patients (Trauma)]]

'''Arvin''' came into the ER after crashing the car he was driving into a wall outside the hospital.


Arvin was learning to drive from [[Noah (At Last)|Noah]], along with [[Rhys]]. When Rhys passed out in the car, Noah had Arvin drive them to the hospital. While trying to park, Arvin ran the car into a wall. Because of the crash, Alex brought him into the ER and checked him out. Alex proclaimed that he had no sign of any injuries.

He called his dad from the ER and assured him that while he'd run into a wall, he was okay.



His father was worried about him. Arvin tried to downplay the damage he'd done to the car he was driving when talking to him.

'''Asha''' is one of the kids who came to Seattle from Africa to have surgery.


Asha had sustained internal injuries from a bomb explosion six years prior. Due to lack of proper care and the fact that she had AIDS, she hadn't healed properly. While she was in the hospital, she began to cough up blood. They couldn't stop the bleeding, so they rushed her into surgery. She had a perforated abdomen and intestinal TB, which made it look like someone had poured glue into her abdomen. They were able to repair the perforation without having to remove much of the bowel and planned to start anti-TB meds afterward.

April was concerned because Asha was very scared and hadn't eaten anything since arriving at the hospital. She wanted to give Asha some food that would be familiar, so she made her a kind of corn porridge in the hopes that she might eat it.


*She was ten at the time of her hospitalization.

'''Audrey''' is the girlfriend of [[Malar Pascowitz]].


Audrey came to the hospital with her boyfriend, Malar, ate his novel, which he believed was terrible, and caused a bezoar. She's the one who finally told the doctors what he had eaten. She sat by his side as he waited for surgery and then afterward when he was diagnosed with and treated for Mercury poisoning.



She is dating [[Malar Pascowitz]]. She was frustrated because they couldn't get married for three years because he had to finish his book.


*She knits.
*She claims that the novel wasn't actually that bad and she read almost every draft.

'''Baby Sloan''' is the biological child of [[Sloan Riley]] and grandson of [[Mark Sloan]]. He was adopted by Trish and Keith shortly after his birth.



Sloan gave birth in Mark's apartment late at night after coming to him in active labor. The baby wasn't making sounds initially, but started to cry after [[Arizona Robbins]] stimulated him. At the hospital, he was stable and able to go to the newborn nursery. Sloan briefly considered keeping him, but ultimately called Trish and Keith, his parents, to come get him. His mom held him and his dad observed that he had her father's chin.

'''Barbara Robbins''' is the mother of [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]] and [[Timothy Robbins]].


Barbara and her husband came into town for their daughter's wedding to [[Callie Torres]]. While she was there, she doted over her granddaughter, showing off the clothes she'd bought for her.



She is married to\ua[[Daniel Robbins]].


She is the mother of [[Arizona Robbins]] and [[Timothy Robbins]]\uaand the grandmother of\ua[[Sofia Robbin Sloan Torres]]. When she found out about her daughter's sexuality, she accepted it, as she was not surprised. From what it seems, she is also a very enthusiastic grandmother, as she brought Sofia baby clothes.

'''Barry Taylor''' was in the hospital to have a whipple to treat his pancreatic cancer.


Barry had advanced pancreatic cancer. Bailey planned to perform a whipple on him. However, Ellis took over the case as an opportunity to show off her technique. However, she ignored the fact that Barry had deep vein thrombosis, meaning that his iliac veins were not suitable for grafting. She had to cut into his neck to graft his renal vein instead. As he went to retrieve the graft, Alex was splattered with blood and noted that he may have nicked the carotid artery. Ellis was able to finish the surgery successfully despite her embarrassment.



He is married to [[Jill Taylor]]. He and his wife were both confused as to the change of surgeon when Ellis took over the case from Bailey.


*He was  at the time of his whipple.

'''Beatrice Carver''' is a patient who had terminal cancer.


Beatrice had been diagnosed with cancer. They took her into surgery to remove some of the mets in her lungs, but they found that they'd adhered to chest wall, meaning she was terminal. They removed a tumor that had been obstructing her airway, which allowed her to breathe more easily, but they advised her that she was going to die.

She told them she wanted them to go back in and cut out whatever she could to give her as much time as possible because her daughter didn't know she had cancer. They said any additional surgery would be too much stress on her body.

Beatrice tried to leave the hospital against medical advice because her daughter's birthday was the next day and she knew it would be the last birthday they spent together and didn't want it to celebrate it in the hospital. Alex convinced her to stay by saying she didn't want to risk dying in front of her daughter, who wasn't even aware she was sick.

She later told her daughter that she was sick and gave her all the advice she would have given her over the years.



She has a daughter, [[Amelia Carver|Amelia]]. When she was diagnosed with cancer, she didn't tell her daughter. Even when she was told she was going to die, she wanted to hide her diagnosis from Amelia. She later told her daughter and gave her all the advice she was going to give her over the years.

'''Becca Wells''' is one of a group of college students who were in an accident on their way to graduation. She was the only survivor of the crash.


While on their way to their college graduation, Becca Wells, [[David Simons]], [[Jordan]], Michelle, Pete, and Dana were in a car accident. Becca's stomach was herniating into her chest, so she was taken into surgery. Before her surgery, Alex had her recite her speech to him in order to distract her from her friends' deaths. She survived her surgery and was stable and awake afterward.



In the ER, she lamented never having slept with [[David Simons]]. She didn't want to have a relationship until after school, but knew she could have fallen in love with him.


She rode to the graduation with several of her friends. She was the lone survivor of the crash.


*She was  at the time of her accident.
*She was valedictorian of her class.

'''Beth Dean''' is the mother of [[Gage Dean]].


Beth was at the hospital with her son, Gage, who needed surgery on his throat. She and Gage's father were engaged in a contentious custody battle over Gage, which resulted in them fighting over him at the hospital. When Gage disappeared from his hospital room, Beth believed his father had taken him. a [[Hospital Codes#Code Pink|Code Pink]] was called and Alex started searching the hospital. He found Gage hiding under a staircase. The Code Pink was called off and Gage was reunited with Beth. He told Alex he was scared because of his surgery, but Alex assured him he'd be fine and he'd feel so much better afterward.



She and Gage's father are no longer together.


She and her ex are engaged in a custody battle over their son, Gage.

'''Bethany Anderson''' is the mother of [[Wallace Anderson]].


Bethany was at the hospital with her son, Wallace, who had short gut syndrome. She and her husband requested a meeting with a board representative and the Chief and they said they wanted Arizona there as well. In the meeting, they revealed that they planned to donate $ million to the hospital, half to continue research to find a cure for Wallace's condition and half to the hospital itself.

When they found out that Wallace had another bowel obstruction, [[Arizona Robbins]] advised against surgery, saying she wasn't confident he would survive. She instead encouraged them to prepare themselves and Wallace. However, they pressured her into surgery and she operated. Wallace survived the surgery, but later went into sepsis and died in a second surgery.

While they were packing Wallace's room, Arizona came to them and asked if they wanted to see Wallace. They said they did and Arizona took them to the morgue, where they viewed Wallace's body and Bethany started to do the "bad dreams" routine she'd done for Wallace while he was alive. When she was unable to continue, Arizona continued for her.



She is married to [[Paul Anderson]].


She and her husband tried to keep their son's life as normal as possible even while he lived in the hospital. To help him sleep, she had a routine she did to banish bad dreams. When Wallace died, she was devastated.

'''Brad Walker''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].


Brad came into the hospital with abdominal pain that had been happening on and off for months. His father believed he was faking it to get out of school, but they ran tests to look for a cause. His scans were all clean, so they wanted to run an exploratory laparoscopy in order to diagnosed chronic mesenteric ischemia. [[Alex Karev]] convinced Brad's father to let them run the test, but it was negative. He became unstable during the surgery, meaning that even though he didn't have chronic mesenteric ischemia, there was definitely something wrong.

They had placed a central line in surgery, but it kinked, so they had to put in a chest tube. Brad started bleeding into the chest tube and his condition was so emergent that Alex had to open his chest in his ICU room in order to stop the bleeding. They then moved him to the OR for surgery. He had a ruptured aortic arch dissection, which they repaired in surgery. After surgery, his parents were told he was doing fine.



His parents, particularly his father, believed he was faking his abdominal pain in order to get out of school.

[[fr:Brad Walker]]

'''Brian Danzinger''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].



Brian came into the ER after passing out in first period English with severe abdominal pain, tremors, and hypertension. He denied drug use. His abdomen was rigid and his hair was falling out. They sedated him and his BP went down. Scans revealed a hemorrhaging liver mass. They informed the parents that his symptoms were consistent with the use of anabolic steroids. The parents confronted him and he admitted that he'd been doing steroids because he wanted girls to like him and he believes they only like guys with crazy bodies. He tried to claim that he'd barely taken any, but his mother said it had been two years, since his sophomore year, as that's when he'd stopped being her boy. They took him into the OR and biopsied the mass. Pathology confirmed that he had liver cancer, but they got it all when they resected the mass. His parents were warned that it could recur if he continued to do steroids. His father insisted that he wouldn't.



When Brian started doing steroids his sophomore year, his mother just believed that he was being a normal teenager.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.

'''Brian Weston''' is a patient who was at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] to have his breasts removed as part of his sex reassignment.


When Brian was , he booked an appointment with [[Alex Karev]] to find out how old he had to be to start his sex reassignment. Alex referred him to a transgender support group, where he met [[Jess (The Face of Change)|Jess]].

At , Brian came back to the hospital after saving up for the last four years to have his breasts removed. Jess came to the hospital to support him. On the other hand, Mr. Weston was highly unsupportive and felt that Brian would change his mind.

The surgery went well. Jess talked to Mr. Weston afterward and admitted that she had sent the e-mail informing him about the surgery because she believed he should know. He offered her all the money he had on him to help out with their rent, but left without speaking to Brian.



Brian is dating Jess, whom he met at a transgender support group. Jess was supportive of Brian's decision to have surgery and stayed at the hospital with him.


Brian's father was not supportive of his decision to have surgery and believed that Brian would change his mind. While speaking to Jess, Mr. Weston repeatedly misgendered his son.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He is a freshman at the University of Washington.

'''Charlotte''' is a firefighter who was burned in the Mt. Baker fire.


While fighting a wildfire on Mt. Baker, Charlotte sustained a burn to one butt cheek. She was brought to the ER, where her burn was treated by [[Arizona Robbins]]. She was told her burn would heal in about six weeks and given crutches to use until it didn't hurt to walk anymore.



[[Alice]]
She is dating Alice. Alice came to the hospital to take her home even though she said she was fine.

[[Arizona Robbins]]
While Arizona was treating her, she flirted with Charlotte. As she was being discharged, Arizona invited her to get a cup of coffee, but the invitation was interrupted by Charlotte's girlfriend coming to get her.


Charlotte is a firefighter with [[Seattle Fire Department]]. While fighting a fire on Mt. Baker, she was burned on her butt. She feels guilty for being happy when there's fires because that's how she makes her living.


*She says no guy has seen her butt since a middle school wardrobe malfunction.

'''Chris''' is the father of [[Thomas Peterson]].



When his son was born at  weeks gestation, Chris came to [[Seattle]] from Cleveland to see him. He was very pessimistic about his odds for survival, using a premature baby outcome predictor that put Tommy's odds of survival at %. When Tommy developed NEC and then went into congestive heart failure, Chris was reluctant to continue treatment. He and Morgan fought over the treatment plan until Morgan gave Chris an out which he took.

Before he left, he asked Alex for an update on Tommy's condition. He looked to Alex for validation of his choice, which Alex refused to give.



Chris was dating [[Morgan Peterson]]. While they were dating, she got pregnant unexpectedly. They continued to date until their son was born premature and he took the out she offered to leave and go back to Cleveland.


Chris and Morgan's son was born premature. From the beginning, Chris was pessimistic about his odds for survival. When Morgan offered him an out to leave Tommy, Chris took it and went back to Cleveland.


Chris is a [[Cardiothoracic Surgery]] [[Resident|resident]] at [[Cleveland Clinic]]. When he had to come to [[Seattle]] after Tommy was born, other residents worked doubles to cover his shifts.

'''Chris Ward''' is the husband of [[Rose Ward]].


Chris's wife, Rose, was at the hospital to have a c-section to give birth to her seventh child. Once Chris and the kids were out of the room, Rose asked Addison to tie her tubes while she was in there doing the c-section. She'd been saving up so that she could pay for it because if they billed insurance, her husband would see it and he's a devout Catholic, so she couldn't let him know. She said that she believed God would understand, but her husband wouldn't.

Addison agreed to do the surgery and after delivering the baby, she pretended she saw bleeding that necessitated tubal ligation. Addison told her after the surgery that she wouldn't be able to have any more babies. She then told her husband, because she wanted him to know Joseph would be their last baby. Chris then went to Alex and asked him about the alleged complication, which led to Alex telling him to get a lawyer.

Addison went to Rose, trying to get her to tell Chris what had happened, but Rose said she wouldn't, saying it was her whole marriage and Addison's malpractice insurance would pay out the claim.



He is married to [[Rose Ward]]. Together, they have seven children. Chris loves Rose and they have a good relationship, but because of Chris's strict religious beliefs, Rose had her tubes tied secretly when she had a c-section. She only told Chris there was a problem in surgery that made her infertile because she wanted him to know that Joseph would be their last baby.


He and his wife have seven children.


*He is devoutly Catholic.
*When he and his wife were first married, she went on the pill because they were so broke and he stopped taking communion during that time.

'''Chuck''' is one of the parents whose baby was in the NICU during the super storm.


During the super storm, the NICU was partially evacuated. However, when the last rig to go out got stuck before leaving the parking lot, they kept the rest of the babies in place in the NICU. When the batteries on their ventilators started to die and no backup batteries were available, the doctors quietly stepped in and manually ventilated the infants. However, when [[Tim (Perfect Storm)|Tim]] alerted the parents to the fact that the batteries were dying, they began to panic. However, [[Derek Shepherd]] and [[Arizona Robbins]] were able to calm them down and teach them how to ventilate their own babies so there would be enough hands to save all of them.



He has a child who was in the NICU at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] during the super storm.

'''Clementine''' came into the emergency room with an allergic reaction to peanut clusters.


Clementine came into the ER with an allergic reaction after eating peanut clusters brought to her by her boyfriend, [[Nico]]. Nico had given her the candy for Valentine's Day. Alex gave her a breathing treatment and IV medication for the rash.

When Clem had a more severe reaction, Alex had to give her epinephrine. Clem later went into anaphylactic shock and had to be intubated. Alex said they'd need to keep her overnight to watch her.

After his mother insisted that they go home, Nico threw a fit and refused to leave as he'd promised Clem that he'd stay. Alex came out and told him that he'd give Clem a message so that Nico and his mother could go home.

Alex read Clem the note, which read,

''"Dear Clementine,''

''I'm really sorry you're sick, but I'm not sorry you're my girlfriend. It's the worst, being alone on Valentine's Day, but I'm thinking about you right now. I'm thinking about holding hands with you and jumping on the trampoline together. I love you. And P.S. I don't care who gave who lice. I'm just glad we both had it together.''

''Love, Nico"''



She is dating [[Nico]], a fellow  year old. They like to hold hands and jump on the trampoline together. They had previously had lice at the same time.


Her mother, Terri, was at the gym when she had her allergic reaction.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.

}}'''Cleo Kim''' is a patient who came into the ER after the roller coaster she was on derailed.


While at an amusement park with her friends, Cleo rode a roller coaster with [[Gregory Williams]]. The roller coaster derailed and the car they were in crashed into the ground. Since Greg had serious crush injuries, the whole car was transported to the hospital so they could be carefully extracted from the car. In the ER, firefighters removed Greg's harness, which left him struggling to breathe. His neck had been fractured, so he was put in traction to stabilize his neck then removed. Once he was out of the car, they noticed that Cleo had a puncture wound to her side that was bleeding heavily. They transfused blood and rushed her into surgery, where her abdomen was repaired.



She is friends with fellow residents, [[Gregory Williams]] and [[Liza Simmons]]. When Greg said they had to do more than just work all the same, they went to a carnival together, which ended poorly when the roller coaster derailed.


She is a second-year [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Resident|resident]] at [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]].


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.
*She specifically requested that Meredith operate on her.
*She does not believe in Hell.
*She's a big fan of the Harper Avery Award, and knew of Meredith, Jackson, and Catherine because of it.

'''Corey Jensen''' is the husband of [[Emily Jensen]].


While his wife, Emily, was pregnant, the fetus was diagnosed with a sacrococcygeal teratoma. Emily and Corey consulted with [[Nicole Herman]] about their options for fetal surgery. However, before anything could be done, the fetus began to bleed into the tumor, causing anemia when Emily was  weeks pregnant. [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]], who was rounding on Emily in Herman's absence, informed Emily and Corey that Herman would likely perform an intrauterine transfusion, which would combat the anemia, which would allow them to make it closer to term.

However, when Herman didn't answer any of her calls, Arizona had to make the decision to perform a c-section and allow Alex to remove the tumor, which would resolve the anemia. After delivering the baby, Arizona decided to go with the baby and Alex, leaving [[Graham Maddox]] to remove Emily's placenta and close. She was quickly paged back when attempting to remove the placenta caused massive bleeding. Arizona jumped in, saying it was placenta percreta and the placenta had invaded other organs. She paged [[April Kepner]], who scrubbed in with her to attempt to save Emily, but they were unable to keep up with blood loss and Emily was pronounced dead in the OR.

After the surgery, Herman explained to Corey that Arizona had made all the right calls and that if she had done the transfusion as planned, he could have lost both Emily and the baby. Placenta percreta is very difficult to detect.

The baby, despite being premature, was doing well in the NICU after surgery.



Corey was married to [[Emily Jensen]] until her death. They have one daughter together.


Corey has one daughter. She was delivered via emergency c-section after being diagnosed in utero with a tumor.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Jensen, Corey}}

'''Courtney Hall''' is a patient who was pregnant with quadruplets.


Courtney was pregnant with quadruplets. During her pregnancy, two of the fetuses were diagnosed with TTTS, so Arizona did fetal surgery to separate the vessels. It was successful, but Courtney was put on bed rest with continuous fetal monitoring as she recovered. Ben did an ultrasound and was able to locate three of the fetuses easily, but Baby C, whom they were calling Charles, the only male, wasn't where he expected, so he paged Arizona. She located Charles, but noted that he had descended and Courtney was in labor. They moved her to the OR in case they had to deliver the babies and gave her medicine to try to stop her labor. Her labor didn't slow and Charles started having late decels. When Arizona examined Courtney, she said she'd have to deliver Charles because he was already partially born. Courtney begged her to do something, to save her babies, and Arizona decided to deliver Charles, then sterilize his cord and put it back inside, reducing the chance of infection and stopping labor to give the other three fetuses a chance to continue gestating.

Charles was born and then Courtney's cervix was stitched closed. Charles was taken to the NICU, where he was oxygenating well despite his prematurity. Doug came to visit him and used a tablet with video chat so Courtney could see him as well.



She is married to [[Doug Hall]].


She was pregnant with quadruplets. One of the babies, [[Charles Hall|Charles]], had to be delivered at  weeks, but they were able to stop labor, giving the other three more time to grow and develop.


She is an accountant. While she was a patient, [[Miranda Bailey]] consulted with her on her own taxes and eventually hired her to do them.


*The babies she was carrying were nicknamed Ariel, Barbara, Charles, and Daniel by the medical team. However, only one name, Charles, made it into the script. In the final script, three of the fetuses were female.
*Baby B is a kicker.

'''Crystal''' is one of the parents whose baby was in the NICU during the super storm.


During the super storm, the NICU was partially evacuated. However, when the last rig to go out got stuck before leaving the parking lot, they kept the rest of the babies in place in the NICU. When the batteries on their ventilators started to die and no backup batteries were available, the doctors quietly stepped in and manually ventilated the infants. However, when [[Tim (Perfect Storm)|Tim]] alerted the parents to the fact that the batteries were dying, they began to panic. However, [[Derek Shepherd]] and [[Arizona Robbins]] were able to calm them down and teach them how to ventilate their own babies so there would be enough hands to save all of them.



She has a child who was in the NICU at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] during the super storm. She was initially reluctant to try manually ventilating her daughter, but [[Jo Wilson|Jo]] assured her that it was easy and helped her do it correctly.

'''Daniel Kiefer''' is a baby who was born with a large tumor on his liver.


Daniel was born with a large liver tumor that was invading his kidneys and causing his heart to fail. His parents were tested as potential matches for him and his sister, who had the same type of tumor, but only their father was a match, meaning that a choice had to be made to save one or the other. They were tested aggressively to see which of them was more likely to survive the transplant, but their statuses were roughly equal, complicating the decision. Alex Karev eventually decided that he needed to open both of them up and take a look directly at the tumors before he could make a decision. Once he did so, he decided that Emma would get the liver. While Emma got her transplant, Alex decided to try a last-ditch effort to save both and attempted to resect Daniel's tumor. However, Daniel arrested after the tumor was resected and Alex took him off the machines and held him while he died.



He and his twin sister, Emma, were both born with aggressive liver tumors. When Emma was determined to have a better chance for survival, she received a liver transplant from their father and Daniel died.


*He was the younger of the twins.

'''Daniel Robbins''' is the father of [[Arizona Robbins]].



His father died on the USS Arizona during the attack of Pearl Harbor in World War II.


Daniel and his wife came into town for their daughter's wedding to [[Callie Torres]]. Daniel meticulously scheduled every minute of the day before and the day of the wedding. When his daughter asked him about lighting a candle for her brother, he brushed it off, saying there wasn't time in the ceremony.



He is married to [[Barbara Robbins]].


He is the father of\ua[[Arizona Robbins]] and [[Timothy Robbins]]. He is also the grandfather of\ua[[Sofia Robbin Sloan Torres]].

When Arizona came out, he was rather accepting, asking if she was still the daughter he raised her to be.

When Arizona was a child and they'd move to a new place, he always took her skating, so she'd have something familiar that felt like home. ''("[[Fight For Your Mind]]")''


He is a colonel in the US Marine Corps.


*Unlike Arizona, Daniel seems to prefer to deal with the loss of Timothy by not talking about him. He didn't include a moment to light a candle for Timothy in the wedding plans of his daughter's wedding, and when Arizona wanted to discuss this, her mother told her not to push it, indicating that Daniel is not comfortable talking about Timothy.

'''Danny''' was hospitalized for chronic liver rejection as he waited for another liver became available.


Danny was being raised by his older sister, [[Kathy (With or Without You)|Kathy]] after the deaths of their parents.

At some point in his past, Danny received a liver transplant. Later, his body started to reject that liver, so he was in the hospital waiting for another liver to become available for transplant. [[Alex Karev]] took the case to [[Meredith Grey]] to look for more treatment options. She examined Danny and decided that she wanted to rebuild his biliary tree, which would prevent further infections and give him more time to wait for a transplant and would even allow him to go home while he waited. Danny wanted the surgery, but Kathy was scared of the risks.

When Danny's conditioned worsened, he again insisted that he wanted the surgery. Kathy admitted that he was almost an adult and had very little control over his own life, so she agreed to do what he wanted and Danny had the surgery. In surgery, he had a lot of bleeding, so Meredith put in a shunt, but the anastomosis leaked. They tried to repair the damage, but despite their best efforts, Danny died in the OR. When they told Kathy, she was devastated to hear of his death.



Following the death of their parents, Danny was being raised by his older sister, Kathy. She said Danny was her whole world and was devastated when he died.


*He was  at the time of his death.
*He's a fan of hockey.

'''Devo Friedman''' is a patient who came in with excessive bleeding after a root canal.


Devo had a root canal and couldn't stop bleeding afterward, so she was taken to the hospital. At the hospital, they detected a heart murmur. She needed a heart valve replacement. She was diagnosed with Von Willebrand disease, which made her ineligible for a mechanical heart valve. Her religious beliefs prevented her from accepting a porcine valve, so she challenged the doctors to come up with another possible solution. After some research, Alex determined that she could get a bovine valve instead, which was even better because it would last longer. Burke was reluctant to do the procedure as he hadn't done it before, but he ultimately agreed to do it. During the procedure, he consulted with [[Dr. Chesney]], who had done the procedure before.



Devo had a somewhat contentious relationship with her parents because she was more devoutly religious than they are. She was upset when they tried to convince her to have a porcine valve placed in her heart.


*She is an Orthodox Jew.
*She was  at the time of her valve replacement.
*She calls herself Esther.
*She asked for a rabbi to bless her before her surgery.

'''Dina Walker''' is the mother of [[Brad Walker]].


Dina came into the hospital with her son, Brad, when Brad had severe, intermittent abdominal pain. When his tests were negative, [[Alex Karev]] and [[Arizona Robbins]] wanted to run an exploratory laparoscopy. Dina's husband, Jim, initially refused, believing that Brad was just faking, but when Alex told him that Brad could die if he had what they thought he did, his parents agreed.

Brad was moved to the ICU after surgery and his parents were angry that the laparoscopy hadn't shown anything. However, Brad started bleeding from his chest and had to be rushed into surgery. He had a ruptured aortic arch dissection which was the cause of his pain.

Brad's surgery was successful and his parents were told he was doing fine. However, they were still angry that the doctors hadn't caught the problem earlier. Alex Karev confronted him, saying that if they'd taken Brad home like they wanted, he would have died.



She is married to [[Jim Walker]].


Her husband didn't believe their son when he said he had severe, intermittent abdominal pain. However, it turned out that Brad had a serious problem with his heart and needed surgery. His parents were told he was doing okay afterward.

'''Dorie Danzinger''' is the mother of [[Brian Danzinger]], a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].



Brian came into the ER after passing out in first period English with severe abdominal pain, tremors, and hypertension. He denied drug use. His abdomen was rigid and his hair was falling out. They sedated him and his BP went down. Scans revealed a hemorrhaging liver mass. They informed the parents that his symptoms were consistent with the use of anabolic steroids. The parents confronted him and he admitted that he'd been doing steroids because he wanted girls to like him and he believes they only like guys with crazy bodies. He tried to claim that he'd barely taken any, but his mother said it had been two years, since his sophomore year, as that's when he'd stopped being her baby. They took him into the OR and biopsied the mass. Pathology confirmed that he had liver cancer, but they got it all when they resected the mass. His parents were warned that it could recur if he continued to do steroids. His father insisted that he wouldn't.



She is married to [[Ken Danzinger]] and they have a son, [[Brian Danzinger]].


When Brian started doing steroids his sophomore year, his mother just believed that he was being a normal teenager.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Danzinger, Dorie}}

'''Doris Friedman''' is the mother of [[Devo Friedman]].


Doris's daughter, Devo, had a root canal and couldn't stop bleeding afterward, so she was taken to the hospital. At the hospital, they detected a heart murmur. She needed a heart valve replacement. She was diagnosed with Von Willebrand disease, which made her ineligible for a mechanical heart valve. Her religious beliefs prevented her from accepting a porcine valve, so she challenged the doctors to come up with another possible solution. After some research, Alex determined that she could get a bovine valve instead, which was even better because it would last longer. Burke was reluctant to do the procedure as he hadn't done it before, but he ultimately agreed to do it. During the procedure, he consulted with [[Dr. Chesney]], who had done the procedure before.



She is married to [[Sam Friedman]]. Together, they have a daughter.


She has one daughter, Devo.


*She and her husband practice Reform Judaism.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Friedman, Doris}}

'''Doug Hall''' is the husband of [[Courtney Hall]].


Doug's wife, Courtney, was pregnant with quadruplets. During her pregnancy, two of the fetuses were diagnosed with TTTS. [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]] did fetal surgery to separate the vessels. It was successful, but Courtney was put on bed rest with continuous fetal monitoring as she recovered. Ben did an ultrasound and was able to locate three of the fetuses easily, but Baby C, whom they were calling Charles, the only male, wasn't where he expected, so he paged Arizona. She located Charles, but noted that he had descended and Courtney was in labor. They moved her to the OR in case they had to deliver the babies and gave her medicine to try to stop her labor. Her labor didn't slow and Charles started having late decels. When Arizona examined Courtney, she said she'd have to deliver Charles because he was already partially born. Courtney begged her to do something, to save her babies, and Arizona decided to deliver Charles, then sterilize his cord and put it back inside, reducing the chance of infection and stopping labor to give the other three fetuses a chance to continue gestating.

Charles was born and then Courtney's cervix was stitched closed. Charles was taken to the NICU, where he was oxygenating well despite his prematurity. Doug came to visit him and used a tablet with video chat so Courtney could see him as well.



He is married to [[Courtney Hall]].


His wife was pregnant with quadruplets. One of the babies, [[Charles Hall|Charles]], had to be delivered at  weeks, but they were able to stop labor, giving the other three more time to grow and develop.


*He bought a gift basket for the doctors.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Hall, Doug}}

'''Drew McNeil''' is a child who had a perforated ulcer after pectus excavatum surgery.


Drew was born with pectus excavatum. He had surgery about it and afterward, was in serious abdominal pain. [[Meredith Grey]] called [[Robert Stark]]. He came, examined Drew, and then said it was just gas. He left her and went back to his night. They gave him an antiflatulent, but his pain was getting worse, so they ran some tests to figure out what was wrong.

A CT revealed a perforated ulcer, but Stark didn't respond to his pages, so Drew needed surgery. They called Stark, but he didn't answer his pages, so they took him into surgery without an attending. His surgery went well.



Drew's mother is very protective of him and demanded that the doctors take her concerns seriously when he had post-op pain.

'''Ed Benson''' is the husband of [[Teresa Benson]].


When Ed's wife, Teresa, was five, her father went in for an appendectomy. He was told it wasn't a big deal, but then he died. Teresa was left with a strong fear of medical procedures and equated surgery with death.

When Teresa grew up, she became pregnant. The baby was diagnosed in utero with spina bifida. Teresa had to overcome the fear to come to the hospital for the surgery. She made it to the hospital, but after they went to sedate her, she panicked and left, saying she'd try to come back.

Arizona went to her home and spoke to her about being a mother and doing what was best for her daughter. She then helped Teresa every step of the way, getting her to the hospital and overcoming the anxiety. She was then sedated for the surgery. After the surgery, she was told it went well and their daughter would be okay.



He is married to [[Teresa Benson]].


His wife is pregnant with their first child, a daughter.

'''Elaine Verma''' is the mother of [[Nicole Verma]].


Elaine's daughter, Nicole, was paralyzed from the waist down. She was admitted to the hospital when she had spasms that caused her legs to jerk involuntarily and she needed a procedure to control the pain. During the consult, Derek asked if she'd considered a cystoplasty, which would enlarge her bladder and create a stoma, negating the need for a catheter and giving her more independence. Her mother was reluctant and said she didn't need it.

Because Nicole was , under the guise of getting more tests, Derek had Alex take Nicole on a walk without her parents. He talked to her while they were walking and she eventually decided she wanted the surgery even though her mother didn't want it.



She is married to [[Mr. Verma]]. Together, they have one daughter.


She is very protective of her daughter. She made many of her decisions for her and decided against a procedure that would give her more independence from her parents.

'''Emily Jensen''' came into the hospital to have fetal surgery, but ultimately died during the emergency delivery.


While she was pregnant, Emily's fetus was diagnosed with a sacrococcygeal teratoma. She and her husband, Corey, consulted with [[Nicole Herman]] about their options for fetal surgery. However, before anything could be done, the fetus began to bleed into the tumor, causing anemia when Emily was  weeks pregnant. [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]], who was rounding on Emily in Herman's absence, informed Emily and Corey that Herman would likely perform an intrauterine transfusion, which would combat the anemia, which would allow them to make it closer to term.

However, when Herman didn't answer any of her calls, Arizona had to make the decision to perform a c-section and allow Alex to remove the tumor, which would resolve the anemia. After delivering the baby, Arizona decided to go with the baby and Alex, leaving [[Graham Maddox]] to remove Emily's placenta and close. She was quickly paged back when attempting to remove the placenta caused massive bleeding. Arizona jumped in, saying it was placenta percreta and the placenta had invaded other organs. She paged [[April Kepner]], who scrubbed in with her to attempt to save Emily, but they were unable to keep up with blood loss and Emily was pronounced dead in the OR.

After the surgery, Herman explained to Corey that Arizona had made all the right calls and that if she had done the transfusion as planned, he could have lost both Emily and the baby. Placenta percreta is very difficult to detect.

The baby, despite being premature, was doing well in the NICU after surgery.



Emily was married to [[Corey Jensen]] until her death. They have one daughter together.


Emily's baby was diagnosed in utero with a tumor. A complication necessitated the premature delivery of the baby and Emily died during the c-section.


*She stayed in room .
*She was pronounced dead at : PM.

'''Emma Kiefer''' is a baby who was born with a large tumor on her liver.


Emma was born with a large liver tumor that was invading her kidneys and causing her heart to fail. Her parents were tested as potential matches for her and her brother, who had the same type of tumor, but only her father was a match, meaning that a choice had to be made to save one or the other. They were tested aggressively to see which of them was more likely to survive the transplant, but their statuses were roughly equal, complicating the decision. Alex Karev eventually decided that he needed to open both of them up and take a look directly at the tumors before he could make a decision. Once he did so, he decided that Emma would get the liver. Emma received the transplant and immediately started to improve while her brother died after an attempt at saving him by resecting the tumor.



She and her twin brother, Daniel, were both born with aggressive liver tumors. When she was determined to have a better chance for survival, she received a liver transplant from her father.


*Her apgar at birth was .
*She was the older of the twins.
