{{Attending Infobox |image = xEmmaMarling.png |name = Emma Marling ||status = Alive |title = M.D. |marital = Ex-husband |siblings = At least two sisters |job = [[Attending#Department Head|Head]] of [[Maternal-Fetal Medicine]] |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]] '''Former'''
[[Cleveland Clinic]]
[[University of Washington School of Medicine]] |first appearance = [[Puttin' on the Ritz]] |last appearance = [[You've Got to Hide Your Love Away]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Marguerite Moreau]] }} '''Emma Marling''' is the [[Attending#Department Head|Head]] of [[Maternal-Fetal Medicine]] at [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]]\uaand\ua[[Owen Hunt|Owen's]]\uaex-girlfriend. Emma grew up with sisters, which is why she was sure that she wanted to have two girls in the future, even though "they're hell" in junior high. After she got employed at the\ua[[Cleveland Clinic]], Emma met a guy whom she married. When their marriage ended in a divorce, the situation became untenable and started to affect her work, which is why Emma decided to move. ''("[[Two Against One]]")'' Following the super-storm that raged over Seattle, [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]] was in serious financial trouble, much like rival hospital,\ua[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. Emma pitched to the hospital board to have a fundraising gala in an effort to raise the necessary finances, but, unfortunately, they denied her request. Having been turned down, she decided to take part in Grey Sloan's fundraising gala, intending to "borrow" some of the donors. As a man went to make a donation to hear the promised story, Emma approached Owen to tell him she'd like to hear the story, too. She complimented the party, and they started talking about the clowns. Emma told him she had been afraid that they wouldn't have anything to talk about, but was relieved that they did. As Owen saw Cristina having fun with a donor, he proposed having a drink with Emma. They were interrupted by Cristina, and Owen introduced them. Cristina then pushed Emma to go see a magician, and Emma took her drink and went to see "the magic". Owen later overheard how Emma was talking to donors, stealing his story. Owen told her he had been watching her and that noticed that she was a thief, asking who she was. She revealed she was a\ua[[Maternal-Fetal Medicine|maternal-fetal surgeon]]\uaat\ua[[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital|Seattle Pres]]\uaand that she used the gala to gather donations for her own hospital. She told him she was only borrowing his story, and thereby wasn't a thief. Owen asked her why she spent so much time talking to him when she was at the party to collect donations, and she confessed she found him a goodlooking man. She and Owen sticked together to listen to Jackson's speech, though Owen had to leave her when he had to take care of [[Ari Rocchi]] after she threw herself under the falling acrobat.\ua At the end of the night, Emma went to Grey Sloan Memorial to talk to Owen. She interrupted Cristina and Owen's conversation and said she had worked up a good excuse, but when she was face to face with Owen, she completely blanked. Cristina noticed that Owen was charmed by her, and left the two of them alone so they could talk in private.\ua''("[[Puttin' on the Ritz]]")'' Emma and Owen stayed in touch after the gala night, and she brought homemade banana bread to his work. He told Callie about it, who commented that it practically made her his girlfriend.\ua''("[[I Bet It Stung]]")'' Emma visited Grey Sloan Memorial again to observe one of Arizona's surgeries, about which Owen had called her. She commented to Owen that she hoped Arizona didn't know that they were dating, as she preferred to keep things professional at work. Owen assured her Arizona didn't, but he confessed that he did tell a couple of people and asked if he shouldn't have. Emma said it was okay, and they shook hands while she thanked him for having called her. As she left to go meet Arizona, she ran into Cristina, who asked Owen if it was "bring your girlfriend towork day".\ua Leah introduced Emma to Arizona, who updated her on the patient. Arizona then asked Leah to show Emma where she could get scrubs, and so Leah did. In surgery, Emma tried to talk about the surgical electrothermal sealers, but Arizona and Alex had a conversation one night stands, Leah Murphy in particular. After surgery, she accidentally left her phone in the scrub room and she met Cristina when she later returned to pick it up. She asked Cristina about her cutting edge approach, and she told Cristina she was impressed by her enormous balls. Emma said she wished she could stick around to watch her surgery, but Cristina then informed her that she was Owen's ex, which Emma didn't know. The situation got awkward, and she quickly left after having told Cristina she couldn't wait to hear how the surgery went.\ua''("[[Map of You]]")'' After finding out about Owen's past marriage through her conversation with Cristina, Emma decided that Owen wasn't ready yet for a new relationship yet as he hadn't told her himself. She told him to call her when he was ready, which he did on Halloween. He left her a message to tell her that, in contrast to his relationship with Cristina where everything was difficult, she was simple and easy. He realized that it sounded wrong and asked her to delete the message. He hung up, but apparently Emma had listened to his message as he was leaving it, as she immediately called him back.\ua''("[[Thriller]]")'' When an opening for maternal-fetal surgeon became available at Grey Sloan, Arizona thought of Emma first and pitched her to the board. They wanted one of them to sit down with Emma to interview her, and Callie was the chosen one. While Callie was eager to get to know Emma, Emma was informed by Arizona that Callie was her ex-wife. They met and after Owen introduced her to Callie, Emma and Callie entered a conference room for the interview. In the interview, they looked over Emma's resume, which is impressive according to Callie. She revealed that she left [[Cleveland Clinic]] after a year because she was going through a divorce at the time. Callie was curious for details, and Emma told her some more. Callie asked her if it was hard for her to leave her city, which Emma found to be a difficult question to answer. When Callie asked Emma what her typical Saturday looks like, Emma said she had no problems with working in the weekends, but Callie was more wondering about what she did for fun. "What feeds your soul?" Callie asked, and Emma responded that she likes to read, to cook and to watch movies. Callie then asked if she had kids from her previous marriage, and when Emma said she hadn't, Callie wanted to know if she was interested in ever having kids. "I don't think you can legally ask me this in a job interview," Emma said, but she did answer the question by saying she imagines having two girls in the future, even though she knows girls are hell in junior high. When Callie wanted to ask some more questions, Owen came in to ask how the interview was going, and Emma turned her head to tell him it was going great, Callie made very enthusiastic signals to Owen. When Emma turned her head back towards Callie, Callie said in a neutral voice that they were making progress.\ua After the interview, Arizona told Emma that Callie loved her. Emma said that Callie was thorough but very nice, and asked how long they'd been divorced. Arizona said that they weren't, just separated, and Emma noticed she still had the ring on her finger. She remarked that she was obviously seeing other people though, and Arizona said they were. Emma apologized for being so personal, and said that the job interview was more intimate than most rectal exams. "We don't do things like this at Seattle Pres," Emma said, and Arizona then suggested to take the job, as the employees of Grey Sloan Memorial do way too personal on a daily basis.\ua That night, Emma waited for Owen outside the hospital. Owen told her that everyone loves her, but Emma said she couldn't work at the hospital. She complimented the people working with him, but she thought that they were his people, who loved and cared about him. Emma said she didn't want to work with her husband again, because if she and Owen would break up, everyone at the hospital would choose him and she would just be the bitch who broke his heart. Owen asked if she was planning on breaking his heart, and she told him she wasn't. He then tried to get her to take the job, but she said she couldn't. She told him not to break her heart either and walked off. ''("[[Two Against One]]")'' While at GSM to prepare a grant proposal to fund her research, Emma was visited by several of the GSM doctors. One of them was Meredith, who tasted a muffin and, when learning that Emma had made them herself, said she wanted the leftovers if Emma was cooking Thanksgiving dinner. Emma and Owen realized they hadn't made plans for Thanksgiving and Meredith offered Emma the chance to cook at her house, because her kitchen is larger than Owen's and Emma's apartment was being painted. Throughout the course of the day, several others ended up being invited to the dinner, including Cristina. Emma said it was okay with her because Owen had told her he was over her. ''("[[Somebody That I Used to Know]]")'' Emma attended April and Matthew's failed wedding with Owen. ''("[[Get Up, Stand Up (Grey's Anatomy)|Get Up, Stand Up]]")'' After dating for several months, Owen and Emma talked about his living situation. He suggested that they move in together and she accepted. However, before they had a chance to choose a place, he cheated on her with Cristina. He broke up with her, but didn't tell her about the cheating. ''("[[You've Got to Hide Your Love Away]]")'' [[Owen Hunt]] Emma seemed to take somewhat of an interest in Owen at the fundraising gala, where she complimented his looks, and later that night, she came to the hospital just to talk to him. ''("[[Puttin' on the Ritz]]")'' After the evening she kept seeing him and even sent him homemade banana bread for work, which caused his colleagues to name her his girlfriend. ''("[[I Bet It Stung]]")'' By the time she came to the hospital to observe a surgery, Emma and Owen were dating. During her visit, she also met Cristina and found out from her about Owen and Cristina's past, which made her realize that Owen wasn't ready to date just yet. ''("[[Map of You]]")'' She said goodbye to Owen, telling him to call her when he was ready to move on, and after some struggle and pondering, he did. ''("[[Thriller]]")'' Some time later, Emma was offered a job at Grey Sloan, but she turned down the offer, not wanting to risk working at the same place with Owen and being left out if something were to happen between them. ''("[[Two Against One]]")'' When things between them got serious, Owen and Emma discussed getting a place together. However, later that same day, Cristina came to the trailer drunk and she and Owen slept together. Owen broke up with Emma the next day, saying they wanted different things, but leaving out that he had cheated on her. ''("[[You've Got to Hide Your Love Away]]")'' [[Arizona Robbins]] Ever since Emma came to the hospital to observe one of Arizona's teratoma surgeries, she and Arizona formed a good professional relationship. When a position of a [[Maternal-Fetal Medicine|maternal-fetal surgeon]] became available at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital|Grey Sloan Memorial]], Arizona immediately thought of Emma and pitched her to the board. Arizona really liked her and wanted her to take the job, though Emma eventually decided not to. ''("[[Two Against One]]")'' Dr. Emma Marling is the\ua[[Attending#Department Head|head]] [[Maternal-Fetal Medicine|maternal-fetal surgeon]]\uaat\ua[[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]], where she started researching minimally invasive in utero teratomas. Dr. Marling was an [[Attending|attending]] for a year before she was promoted to run the department. Prior to working at Seattle Presbyterian, Dr. Marling was an [[attending]] at the [[Cleveland Clinic]], focusing on congenital heart disorders,\uafor a year and spent time at University of Washington Medical Center. When a maternal-fetal surgeon opening became available at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], Dr. Marling was recommended by head [[Pediatric Surgery|pediatric surgeon]] [[Arizona Robbins|Dr. Arizona Robbins]]. After she interviewed with the board, represented by [[Orthopedic Surgery|orthopedic surgeon]] [[Callie Torres|Dr. Callie Torres]], Dr. Marling was offered the position; unfortunately, she declined the offer as she didn't like the idea of working at the same place with [[Owen Hunt|Dr. Owen Hunt]]. *Dr. Marling makes a voice-only appearance near the end of [[Thriller]]. *[[Alex Karev|Alex]]\uatold Arizona he thinks Emma is a good-looking woman. *She has a German Shepherd mix named Lila.[[Two Against One]], x *She enjoys reading, cooking, and watching movies.[[Two Against One]], x *She hates camping.[[You've Got to Hide Your Love Away]], x xEmmaMarling.png|[[Puttin' on the Ritz]] xEmmaMarling.png|[[Map of You]] xEmmaMarling.png|[[Two Against One]] xEmmaMarling.png|[[Somebody That I Used to Know]] xEmmaMarling.png|[[Get Up, Stand Up (Grey's Anatomy)|Get Up, Stand Up]] xEmmaMarling.png|[[You've Got to Hide Your Love Away]] x-.jpg {{Emma Marling Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[de:Emma Marling]] [[fr:Emma Marling]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Marling, Emma}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]]

'''Eric Choudry''' is the husband of [[Rita Choudry]].



Eric and his wife, Rita, had a two year old daughter named Madeline. One day, while they were walking, Madeline asked to let go of Rita\us hand so she could run. She then slipped and hit her head, killing her. Rita always believed that her daughter died because she let go of her hand.


Rita had Ebstein\us malformation, meaning that when she became pregnant after Madeline's death, maintaining the pregnancy was extremely risky. Eric begged her to terminate the pregnancy, but she was determined to continue. She was put on bed rest at the hospital because of her condition. When she was  weeks pregnant, she complained about upper back pain. Dr. Pierce diagnosed an aortic dissection. She was rushed into emergency surgery, where her baby was delivered and her dissection was repaired.


Rita and Eric\us baby was diagnosed in utero with double inlet left ventricle, meaning she would require surgery immediately after birth. Because of her prematurity, her surgery was even more risky. [[Arizona Robbins|Dr. Robbins]], after exhausting all other options, had the idea to split her one good ventricle into two. It was successful.



He is married to [[Rita Choudry]]. They had two children together.


He had a daughter named Madeline who died in a freak accident when she was two. After Madeline\us death, his wife became pregnant despite the risks and they had another daughter.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Choudry, Eric}}

'''Ethan''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] who had had a horseback riding accident.



Ethan was in a horseback riding accident, in which he was dragged  yards by a horse. He was brought into the hospital with hypotension and bleeding in his abdomen. April suspected that his femoral vein had been lacerated. When he mentioned his shoes, April determined that that was the cause of the accident. He was wearing shoes without a heel, which is dangerous when riding a horse. He was taken to CT and then into surgery. The surgery was successful.

'''Flor Medina''' is a girl who was at the hospital to have her gallbladder removed.


Flor was in the hospital to have her gallbladder removed. However, her pre-op tests showed a choledochal cyst, which made it a more complicated procedure. She was taken into surgery and it went well and she was expected to make a full recovery.



She has a crush on [[Andrew DeLuca]] and didn't want him on her surgery because she didn't want him to see her insides.


Her whole family came to the hospital to celebrate Dia De Los Muertos and be with her before her surgery.

'''Frank Shavelson''' is the son of [[Frankie Shavelson]]


When his mother was pregnant with him, she developed a wandering spleen which was cutting off blood flow. Richard wanted to operate immediately, but Frankie, worried about her baby, convinced him to wait and monitor her. A second ultrasound later revealed that she was doing better, but she later had fluid in her upper right quadrant, likely due to the splenic artery rupturing. She was rushed into surgery. They removed her spleen, but then she hemorrhaged and they couldn't stop the bleeding. Frank was delivered shortly before his mother was declared dead. He was taken to the NICU, where his mother's co-workers watched over him. ''("[[Anybody Have a Map?]]")''

He continued his stay in the NICU and the nurses continued to watch over him. ''("[[Blowin' in the Wind]]")''



His mother died during the same surgery in which he was born.

'''Frankie Shavelson''' was a nurse at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



On Alex's first day as interim chief, Frankie consoled the other nurses, saying their new chief needed time to learn ... to read, as the nurses' schedule was messed up. She later told Bailey that the hospital had been understaffed with nurses. ''("[[Gut Feeling]]")''


When Alex and Jo starting making out in his office at the end of the day, Frankie yelled to them that it's not a private space and others could see them. ''("[[Flowers Grow Out of My Grave]]")''


When she was  weeks pregnant, she collapsed. Her spleen was twisted, but she refused surgery because she was worried about her baby. She had had three rounds of IVF and a miscarriage in order to have her baby, whom she called her last shot. Her spleen started to un-twist, but then she had abdominal bleeding, so she was rushed into surgery. In surgery, the bleed was stopped, but then Frankie crashed, so they did an emergency c-section to deliver her son. After that, they tried to resuscitate her but they were unsuccessful. Richard then delivered the news of her death to the other nurses, who all mourned her. The nurses then watched over her son in the NICU. ''("[[Anybody Have a Map?]]")''



[[Richard Webber]]
Frankie was hired by Richard Webber because of her merits, including the fact she knew her way around a central line better than Richard. They got along well during work and often teased each other. She was fully confident in Richard's ability as a doctor to the point she told one of her fellow nurses to stand down from her care because Richard was taking care of her.


She was a nurse at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


*She was hired by Richard personally.<ref name="Anybody Have a Map?">[[Anybody Have a Map?]], x</ref>
*She was first in her class at nursing school and boasted excellent central line skills.<ref name="Anybody Have a Map?" />
*She was pronounced dead at :.<ref name="Anybody Have a Map?" />

'''Fred Fisher''' is the father of [[Jake Fisher]].


His son, Jake, had been diagnosed with cancer in his leg. He'd had chemo to try to shrink the tumor, but it didn't work and [[Callie Torres]] and [[Arizona Robbins]] recommended amputation. However, because Jake was a ballet dancer, he didn't want to let them take his leg. They did research and [[Alex Karev]] found a case in which they removed the bone that was affected, dosed it with radiation, and then re-implanted it. His parents were worried because it was risky, but they agreed to let him have the surgery. The surgery went well and Jake's labs were good afterward.



He is married to [[Vickie Fisher]].


His son, Jake, is a ballet dancer, a talent that Fred and his wife fully support. Fred even bragged to the doctors about Jake's dancing.

'''Gage Dean''' is a child who disappeared within the hospital.


Gage was in the hospital for a peritonsillar abscess. He was scared of the surgery, so he left his room and hid in the hospital. Because Gage was involved in a custody battle between his parents, which had resulted in a fight that very morning, Alex believed his father had taken him, so he pressured Bailey to call a [[Hospital Codes#Code Pink|Code Pink]]. The code was called, but Alex found Gage hiding under the stairs, so the code was called off and Gage was reunited with his mother. He told his mom he was scared about his surgery, but Alex assured him it would be fine and he'd feel so much better afterward.



Gage's parents were involved in a custody battle over him. Alex says his dad has anger issues.


*He was six at the time of his hospitalization.

'''Glenda Castillo''' is a patient who found out she was pregnant three weeks after her husband died in a car accident who later needed fetal surgery.



Glenda was married to a man named Eddie. Eddie was in a head-on collision and despite Bailey's best efforts, he died of his injuries.


Three weeks after her husband died, Glenda found out she was pregnant. She was uninsured, so she went back to the hospital where her husband died seeking prenatal care. During a prenatal visit, [[Miranda Bailey|Bailey]] found that the baby had a tumor on his lower back. She asked Herman to take the case and once [[Julie Hall|Julie Hall's]] case was dropped due to fetal demise, Herman agreed.

An exam revealed that Glenda's baby was developing hydrops and it was starting to put Glenda herself at risk, so Herman recommended operating that very night. However, Glenda refused because she was only  weeks and knew her baby wouldn't have much of a chance for survival if they had to do an emergency delivery at that point. She decided to wait the extra week, despite the risks to herself. Herman agreed to allow her to wait, but only if she was admitted and carefully monitored.

A week later, Glenda's baby went into distress and she started mirroring, so she had to be rushed into surgery. ''("[[Staring at the End]]")''


Despite some complications, including her baby's heart arresting, Arizona was able to remove Glenda's baby's tumor. She was then discharged to go home and told to return in a month for a post-op exam. ''("[[The Distance]]")''



Glenda was married to Eddie Castillo until his death in a car accident.


Three weeks after her husband died, Glenda found out she was pregnant. Unfortunately, Glenda's baby had a tumor on his back which required fetal surgery.

'''Graham Maddox''' is an [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] [[Resident|resident]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] who worked frequently with [[Nicole Herman]].



As an OB/GYN resident at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], he has worked on several [[Fetal Surgery|fetal surgery]] cases with [[Nicole Herman]]. After\ua[[Arizona Robbins|Dr. Arizona Robbins]] became Herman's fellow, he also worked with her. Their first case together was\ua[[Jaclyn Werlein]]. During surgery, Graham repeatedly complimented Nicole, but told him to stop sucking up. In surgery, Arizona was only allowed to observe as fetal surgery was something completely different than pediatric surgery. After surgery, Graham directed Arizona to the skills lab so she could practice.

However, Arizona soon caught up, leading Nicole to tell Graham to take point from her, as her years of surgical experience led to her knowing her limitations, something Graham could work on. Eventually, after about a month of training, Arizona got to take lead on surgery with Graham assisting her. However, they were forced to do the surgery a day early because there was fetal hydrops, and Nicole noticed how Arizona hesitated for a very brief moment before puncturing. She then stopped Arizona and told her to trade places with Graham.\ua''("[[Bend & Break]]")''

When Herman left for an appointment and left Arizona in charge of her service, she and Graham worked on [[Emily Jensen]], whose baby needed an intrauterine blood transfusion. After they were forced to deliver the baby at  weeks, Arizona left Graham to close while she went with Alex to work on the baby. [[Nurse Ruth]] soon came to get her, saying Graham needed her urgently. Arizona returned to the OR to find Emily bleeding heavily as Graham tried to save her. She took over and Graham defended himself and his work as she operated. Despite her best efforts, she and Arizona were unable to save Emily and she was pronounced dead in the OR. ''("[[Could We Start Again, Please?]]")''

He continued to work closely with Arizona and Herman until they started their very intensive surgical schedule in order to finish Arizona's fellowship before Herman had surgery. ''("[[Risk]]")''



[[Nicole Herman]]
Graham has immense professional respect for Nicole Herman and continuously sucks up to her. Due to her knowledge that she's going to die within  months, Herman started a sexual relationship with Graham, because he was young, fit, and attractive. Graham willingly participated in this arrangement so he could score points with his attending. ''("[[Risk]]")''

[[Arizona Robbins]]
Graham's attitude toward Arizona is slightly competitive at best, and disrespectful at worst, as he treats her as a less competent peer. He doesn't seem to acknowledge or be impressed by Arizona's attending status nor her department head status in pediatric surgery. They have an understanding, but ultimately, he is oblivious to how annoying he comes off to her.


Graham Maddox is an [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]]\ua[[Resident|resident]]\uaat\ua[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].

Graham shows an interest in [[Fetal Surgery|fetal surgery]] as he often rounds on Dr. Herman's service. He specifically chose to work at Grey Sloan due to Herman's reputation as a fetal surgeon and wanted to study under her.

Despite being a nominal surgeon, as described by Herman, Graham has learned to perform advanced fetal surgical procedures, even taking the surgical lead in the O.R. under Herman's supervision.


*As a resident, Graham wears the pink scrubs from [[Obstetrics and Gynecology]] and a disposable scrub cap while in the OR.
*Dr. Herman says he's a complete tool, but a satisfactory sexual partner.<ref>[[Risk]], x</ref>

'''Gregory Williams''' is a patient who came into the ER after the roller coaster he was on derailed.


While at an amusement park with his friends, Greg rode a roller coaster with [[Cleo Kim]]. The roller coaster derailed and the car they were in crashed into the ground. Since Greg had serious crush injuries, the whole car was transported to the hospital so they could be carefully extracted from the car. In the ER, firefighters removed Greg's harness, which left him struggling to breathe. His neck had been fractured, so he was put in traction to stabilize his neck then removed to a gurney, where he was taken to CT. He had bleeding in his abdomen, so he was taken into surgery so that could be repaired and then he had a spinal fusion. After surgery, he was stable.



He is friends with his fellow residents, [[Cleo Kim]] and [[Liza Simmons]].


He is a second-year [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Resident|resident]] at [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]].


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He is\ua[[Liza Simmons|Liza Simmons's]]\uabirthing partner.
*He was wearing a brown jacket similar to one owned by [[George O'Malley]].

'''Gretchen Bitzer''' is a patient who was mistakenly told she was dying.


Gretchen was in the hospital to have a few moles removed. However, there was a lab mix-up and she was told she was dying. When the doctors went to find her to tell her that she wasn't actually dying, they found out she had left the hospital. [[Norman Shales]] left the hospital to find her and brought her back after telling her there was a billing mix-up. She was happy that she was dying, saying she'd left her boyfriend and quit her job and was moving to Reykjavik to live out the rest of her life. However, when they told her she wasn't actually dying, she was upset, saying that she'd quit and left her boyfriend and given up her apartment. The hospital settled with her and gave her enough money to buy a nice house in Reykjavik.



She had a "crappy" boyfriend whom she dumped when she thought she was going to die.


When she thought she was going to die, she quit her job.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.

'''Gretchen Price''' is the mother of [[Lily Price]].


Gretchen's daughter, Lily, had a tumor in her trachea. The tumor was benign but preventing Lily from breathing. After Lily stopped breathing, Gretchen was told that in order to remove the tumor, which had been removed several times before, they'd have to remove Lily's trachea, which would leave her completely unable to breathe, meaning she'd die either way.

However, [[Arizona Robbins]] remembered something she'd read about growing a trachea out of a person's own cells, so they placed a stent to help her breathe and then removed a rib to get cartilage, which they used to grow a trachea, first in a lab and then her abdomen.



Gretchen is raising her daughter, Lily, by herself. When Lily was hospitalized, she was only able to visit a few times a week because they lived so far away.


*She and Lily live three hours away from the hospital.

'''Harley Hernandez''' is a patient who was impaled on a tree while luging.


Harley was street luging when he hit a car and was catapulted into the air. He landed on a pile of tree trimmings and was impaled on a particularly large branch.

They took him into surgery, where they had to remove one of his kidneys and part of his bowel. They worked around the branch, knowing it was tamponading the bleeding. Eventually, they were able to repair enough of the surrounding damage to remove the branch.



Harley's parents are divorced. As he only sees his father every other weekend, his father allowed him to do things he wouldn't have previously, like street luging down a hill, which led to his accident.

'''Hayley May''' was a psych patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] who was incorrectly diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia.



After she started having symptoms that looked like paranoid schizophrenia, she was diagnosed and her parents tried to have her committed to the psychiatric ward.


After she attempted to scratch her eyes out, Hayley had to be cleared by surgery before she could be committed to the psychiatric ward. While her parents were talking to Alex, she grabbed a syringe and threatened to stab herself in the chest. Alex talked her down, saying that he believed her when she said she wasn't crazy. He asked her to put the syringe down so he could run tests. She did and was restrained. However, because he had promised her, Alex wanted to run the tests. Her parents opposed it, saying she'd already had tests and been diagnosed. They agreed to let them run the tests. The scans showed nothing, but Alex wasn't convinced. He said he knows crazy and Hayley isn't crazy. He was given four hours to find another diagnosis, so he enlisted the help of [[Lexie Grey]] and her photographic memory to find the cause. After doing some research, he believed she had Superior Canal Dehiscence Syndrome. They verified the diagnosis and then took her into surgery. The surgery had a chance not to be successful, but it worked and Hayley was excited to be able to function normally.



She had a grandfather who was schizophrenic and had killed himself.


*She was  at the time of her correct diagnosis.

'''Heather''' is a woman who went on half a date with [[Callie Torres]] before she was paged for an emergency at the hospital.



Heather and Arizona had been dating for four weeks when Heather proposed that they get matching tattoos. When Arizona informed Heather that she didn't want to, Heather attacked Arizona with a steak knife.


Heather connected with Callie through an online dating service. They agreed to go on a date, but before they could even have dinner, Callie was paged to the ER for an emergency. Heather accompanied Callie to the hospital and walked her in before kissing her goodbye.

When Callie later found out about Heather's history with Arizona, she decided a second date was out of the question.



[[Arizona Robbins]]
She and Arizona dated for four weeks. The relationship presumably ended when Heather attacked Arizona with a steak knife because she did not not want to get matching tattoos for their four-week anniversary.

[[Callie Torres]]
Heather connected with Callie through an online dating service. They had half a date before Callie was paged away. They shared one kiss in the hospital before Callie left to tend to her patient.

'''Helen Karev''' is the mother of [[Alex Karev]].



When Alex and his siblings were young, Helen often forgot to feed them. Alex resorted to shoplifting to get food for them, which resulted in him being arrested and sent to juvie. ''("[[Sympathy for the Parents]]")''

Later, while Alex was in high school, he was his mother's primary caregiver, making sure she took her meds and calming her down when her delusions got out of hand. ''("[[Old Scars, Future Hearts]]")''


During her adulthood, she started to become less affected by her schizophrenia, helped by her adherence to a strict routine. She returned to her job at the library. When Alex noticed she'd stopped cashing the checks he sent, he went to visit her, worried something had happened. She told him about what had happened and after some resentment, he told her he was happy for her. He introduced her to Jo and they invited her to the wedding, but she said though she'd love to come, she couldn't deviate from her routine. ''("[[Fight For Your Mind]]")''


Helen surprised Alex when she came to Seattle unexpectedly. Jo found her waiting in the hospital waiting room and took her to Catherine's party, where she was headed. Alex worried when he saw her, believing that she'd had a break from reality. When she started smelling smoke at the party when no one else could, he believed it was the break finally showing, but when it turned out there actually was smoke in the apartment, he finally started to relax and be excited to see his mother. After the building was evacuated, Alex introduced Helen to Meredith. ''("[[We Didn't Start the Fire]]")''

Helen continued to knit during her visit, making baby hats for Alex and Jo's future kids. This started some panic in Jo, who felt pressured by the gesture and started to avoid Alex. Helen admitted to Alex that she meant to nudge Jo a little. ''("[[Blood and Water]]")''

While knitting in the cafeteria, Helen met Bailey, who introduced herself and they started talking about Helen's visit. Helen expressed to Bailey her concerns about going back home. Traveling to Seattle had been a lot for her and she was worried about making the trip back home and getting back into her routine. Bailey relayed those concerns to Alex, who decided to take a few weeks off to take his mom back home and get her settled back in. ''("[[And Dream of Sheep]]")''


A few months later, Alex lied and said she was in need of help and Alex travelled to Iowa. ''("[[Let's All Go to the Bar]]")''

[[Jo Wilson|Jo]] later called her and said she was fine and Alex never came to see her.



She was married to [[James Evans]] until they divorced after she was diagnosed with schizophrenia.


She has three kids with her ex-husband, [[James Evans]]. Her middle child, [[Aaron Karev|Aaron]], inherited her mental illness. All three of her children spent time in foster care before being returned to her home.


She works at Kanesville Public Library.

'''Hillary Boyd''' is a kid who jumped off the roof while 'shrooming.


Hillary ate mushrooms in order to get high and jumped off her roof because she thought she could fly. She broke  bones in the fall and was rushed to the hospital where she had a very complex surgery. [[Callie Torres]] said that if she faired well enough that day, she'd go back in and repair her subtrochanteric fracture next.

They took her into surgery, but she developed an air embolus, which [[Cristina Yang]] resolved.

After her surgery, she called her drug dealer and asked for more drugs to be brought to the hospital. However, Cristina took her phone and told her that she almost died because of the drugs. She said that the way she was behaving meant she was an idiot. She'd gotten lucky, but she needed to grow up.



When they found out that she'd been on mushroom, her parents were upset, but she told them she's every parent's dream.


She has a friend who deals drugs to her.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.
*She'd never broken a bone before jumping off the roof.
*She's on honor roll, runs the student council, writes for the school newspaper, and tutors kids with reading problems.

'''Hudson Powell''' is a first-year medical student who toured the hospital.


Hudson came to the hospital to tour as a medical student. He was assigned to follow [[April Kepner]]. They worked on the case of [[Sarah Cassidy]]. When [[Mark Sloan]] was trying to convince [[Arizona Robbins]] to use cadaver bones for Sarah instead of her own skull to create her new cheekbones, he drew on Hudson's head with a marker to show her where they'd have to cut for her procedure versus his.

In his evaluation at the end of the day, he said that April was unwilling to delegate.

'''Hunter Chapman''' is a patient whose mom suspected he was doing drugs.


Hunter had been lethargic and irritable, leading his mother to believe he was doing drugs. She brought him to the clinic for a drug test. [[Alex Karev]] said there were many other reasons that he could have those symptoms, but Hunter's mother asked [[Norman Shales]] to run a drug test, speaking to him as if he were the lead doctor because he was so much older than Alex. The drug screen was negative, so Alex suggested more tests. Hunter then had a bout of dysphasia, intending to say he wanted to go home, but actually speaking gibberish.

Hunter was taken for neuro exams and [[Derek Shepherd]] was called to consult. He had hydrocephalus pressing against Broca's area, which is why it affected his speech. They scheduled surgery to place a shunt.

Before he could have surgery, he collapsed in the clinic due to brain herniation. Derek instructed Alex on how to drain the blood to relieve the pressure. His mom was informed that after he had his surgery, the fluid would drain into his abdomen and he'd be okay.



His mother brought him into the clinic for a drug test because she thought he was doing drugs.

'''Jacob''' was a patient in the NICU of [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Jacob was born with an omphalocele, which means that his abdominal organs were in a sack outside his body. Silver sulfadiazine was applied daily as a bridge to delay closure.


While [[Shane Ross|Dr. Ross]] was applying silver sulfadiazine for the day, the omphalocele burst, putting Jacob's life at risk. [[Arizona Robbins|Dr. Robbins]] quickly protected his organs with vicryl mesh. With the risk contained, she planned a double-thickness skin graft and told a nurse to monitor him carefully.

'''Jake Burton''' is a patient who came into the hospital with a brain tumor caused by lionitis.


Jake was born with craniodiaphyseal dysplasia.

He was admitted to the hospital after complaining of headaches and nausea. Scans revealed that he had a brain tumor, because the growths had turned inward.

While Derek planned the tumor resection, Mark proposed a plan to remove the growths from the outside of Jake's skull, giving him a more normal appearance. Derek was against the idea, but Jake wanted the surgery. After convincing his parents, they signed the consent so he could have the surgery. They planned to do both procedures under the same round of anesthesia to make things easier on Jake's body.

Jake died during the tumor resection, but Alex and Cristina had the idea that Mark could still fix his face for his parents. After he was done, Jake's parents came in to see his body and cried.



Jake's parents were scared because of his condition. When [[Mark Sloan]] proposed a way to give him a more normal appearance, they were reluctant to agree to the surgery because they were worried about losing him. When he died, they were devastated.


*He was  at the time of his death.
*He said he always noticed people's eyes because it was the only place on his face where tumors weren't growing.

'''Jake Fisher''' is a young ballet dancer who was diagnosed with osteosarcoma.


Jake had osteosarcoma in his tibia. He'd had chemotherapy and was in the hospital to have a bone dissection. However, when his scans showed that the chemotherapy hadn't worked to shrink the tumor. They wanted to cut off his leg, but he said that he needed it in order to dance. He danced in the hospital to show him why he couldn't have his leg amputated.

[[Arizona Robbins]], [[Callie Torres]], and [[Alex Karev]] researched other options for him. Alex eventually found a case where they'd removed the affected bone, dosed it with radiation, and them put it back in the leg. They planned to do it for Jake. It was risky, but they'd monitor him to make sure the cancer wasn't coming back. His parents acknowledged the risk, but let him decide. He decided to have the procedure. It was successful and his post-ob labs were good.



His parents were highly supportive of his dancing.


*He was  at the time of his cancer treatment.

|job = Musician
|first appearance = [[Puttin' on the Ritz]]
|last appearance = [[Take It Back]]
|count = 
|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[James Remar]]
}}'''James Evans''' was the drug-addict father of [[Alex Karev]].



James and two of his friends got high and crashed their car into a tree. They were the only ones injured in the crash and were taken to the hospital. James had no ID on him, so they called him Jake Doe. He had endocarditis due to his heroin use, which they treated. He also had his tricuspid valve replaced. ''("[[Puttin' on the Ritz]]")''


James stayed in the hospital after his surgery to recover. He had to pass a treadmill test in order to be released from the hospital. While he was doing the test, Jo mentioned the possibility of rehab, but he rejected the idea, saying he was just a recreational user. She called him out on the lying, but he said he couldn't afford the good places. Despite his reassurance that he was fine, Jo went to him and said she got him a bed in a great program. He questioned her motives and rejected her offer. He was discharged and left the hospital. ''("[[I Bet It Stung]]")''


When Alex found out where James and his band were playing, he went to that venue every night. One night, after they finished playing, James came and sat down next to Alex, who offered to pay for his drink. James said he recognized Alex, though Alex tried to brush it off as him being at the shows. James then said he remembered him. He's a doctor from the hospital. He said he met a pediatric surgeon on the scariest night of his life, when his son choked on a strawberry. Alex asked where his family was, but James said it's complicated. He then invited Alex to jam.

They started playing and singing together. James stopped the session to show Alex a picture of his son. Alex was shocked not to see himself, but [[Nicky Evans|Nicky]], a son he had with another woman named Naomi\uaafter leaving Alex's mom. James\uasaid that he hadn't seen them in years because he left them, just like he left Alex's mom. Alex became angry that he not only left his family, but his second family as well. Alex said they were better off without James and then he punched James and left the bar. ''("[[Map of You]]")''


James came back to the hospital, where he requested to see Jo. Jo tried to send him away, but he said he was trying to get clean and then he collapsed on the floor. He was moved to the ER, where Owen gave a treatment plan. When he tried to include methadone, Jimmy refused, saying he wanted to get totally clean.

When Alex visited his hospital room, Jimmy said he'd recognized Alex as soon as he saw him standing over him at the bar. He left the bar and tried to get clean. As he continued to go through withdrawal, he had hallucinations, mostly of Alex's childhood. During one of his hallucinations, he pushed Jo against the wall and had to be restrained. ''("[[Man on the Moon]]")''


When James developed mitral regurgitation, Shane took him into surgery with only Leah to help him. Things went south quickly, but Shane refused to call anyone for help. When Leah figured out that Shane wasn't going to stop and Jimmy could die, she ran to get help. She brought back Webber, who managed to get Shane to step back and took over. ''("[[Get Up, Stand Up (Grey's Anatomy)|Get Up, Stand Up]]")''

Three weeks after his surgery, Jimmy was still alive, but struggling. Alex called [[Naomi Evans|Naomi]] and told her Jimmy had died in order to get her to come visit. She came, but was angry to learn Jimmy was still alive. She took the guitar he'd stolen from her and left. Jimmy woke up afterward and saw the guitar missing. He told Alex taking it was one of the lowest things he'd done and he wanted to give it back, not knowing Naomi had come and taken it. When Jimmy started to struggle to breathe, Alex lied to Jimmy and told him Naomi and Nicky were on their way. He said he'd told them Jimmy loved them. He assured him it was okay, that he could go. A few moments later, Jimmy died. ''("[[Take It Back]]")''



Helen Karev
James was married to Helen Karev. They had three children together, but divorced because of his drug use and her mental health issues.

Naomi Evans
He later married [[Naomi Evans]]. They had one child together. He then left, but they never legally divorced.


James had three children with his first wife: Alex, Aaron, and Amber. Though James did drugs, he did have a good relationship with Alex as a child, as he could remember a time he and his oldest son Alex went to a fair with hazardous rides, but they rode each one twice. When Alex grew up, and his father would abuse his mother, he became a wrestler and beat James near to death. After that, James abandoned them.

Sometime later on, he had another son, Nicky Evans\uawith\uaanother woman, but he abandoned them, too, when Nicky was five.

When he came to Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital, Alex initially recognized him because of the way James called him Sinatra. He had Jo run a DNA test, which confirmed his suspicions. ''("[[Puttin' on the Ritz]]")'' Alex followed him to a bar, where James and his band played for a couple nights. James talked a little bit about his son, and Alex thought he was talking about himself, but when James showed him a picture of the kid, Alex realized it was Nicky, the child James had with his second wife, whom he later left. Alex becomes enraged and punches him in the face, telling him to never talk to the kid, that he was better off without Jimmy. ''("[[Map of You]]")''

When James later returned to the hospital, he started bragging about Alex, telling all the nurses Alex was his son. Alex confronted him about not remembering his own child, but Jimmy said he remembered him. He shared memories with Alex and said he left things better with Naomi and Nicky and might be able to go back. Alex made his peace with Jimmy, saying he was better off without Jimmy, but wished him luck patching things up with Nicky. ''("[[Get Up, Stand Up (Grey's Anatomy)|Get Up, Stand Up]]")''


[[Jo Wilson]]
Jo was his doctor when he arrived at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital and she fought hard for him to try to get his life back together, and tried to get him into a home, but he rejected the offer. He later tried to get clean and she admitted him to help with his withdrawal symptoms.


James was a not very successful musician. He traveled through the United States with his band, mostly playing in bars.


*He was  at the time of his valve replacement.<ref>[[I Bet It Stung]], x</ref>

'''Jared Cassidy''' is the father of [[Sarah Cassidy]].


His daughter, Sarah, was bone without cheekbones. The doctors planned to harvest bone from her own skull to build her new cheekbones. However, [[Mark Sloan]] proposed using cadaver bones instead, because Sarah expressed interest in playing sports, which might not be possible with harvested bone. [[Arizona Robbins]] rejected the idea as being too experimental, but eventually relented. Sarah's parents were worried about the more experimental surgery, but agreed to let her have it when she said that being able to play sports was important to her. Her surgery was performed successfully.



He is married to [[Sophia Cassidy]].


He was concerned about Sarah having the more experimental surgery, but agreed to let her have it after she said she just wanted to be able to play sports.

'''Jared Cole''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Jared had Byler's Disease, which caused him to be severely jaundiced and put him at risk for liver failure. He was in the hospital to have a biliary diversion which would allow the bile to drain out of his abdomen.

The initial plan was to use part of his intestine to make the stoma, but [[Alex Karev]] had the idea to use his appendix instead, removing the need to cut into his healthy intestine. The surgery was successful and after surgery, Jared's skin was a more normal color.

}}
'''Jeffrey''' is the boyfriend of [[Aaron Mafrici]].


Jeffrey came into the ER with his boyfriend, Aaron, when Aaron believed Jeffrey had given him bronchitis. They were both devastated when Aaron was diagnosed with cancer in the lining of his lung. However, they used hot chemo lavage to treat the cancer after removing the tumor and Jeffrey was told that Aaron would be okay. He admitted to [[Alex Karev]] that part of him hoped it wouldn't work so that Aaron could see what the people he looks down on experience.



Jeffrey is involved with [[Aaron Mafrici]]. When Aaron was diagnosed with cancer, he said he didn't want to live if he couldn't keep his lung and Jeffrey wouldn't want him to live like that either. After Aaron's surgery, Jeffrey admitted that a part of him had hoped it wouldn't work, but he wouldn't leave Aaron because he loves him and he's an amazing singer.


He teaches piano to children.

'''Jeffrey Hernandez''' is the father of [[Harley Hernandez]].


When Jeffrey's son, Harley, was injured street luging, he came to the hospital with him. He yelled at his son as they were taking him in, saying he was an idiot. [[Alex Karev]] pulled him back and shoved him into a wall. He was then directed into the hospital where his son had been taken.

Jeffrey waited at the hospital while Harley was in surgery. Once Harley was out of surgery, Jeffrey went across the street to the bar to have a drink. Bailey saw him there and spoke to him about his guilt over how Harley got injured.



He is divorced.


Jeffrey has one son, Harley. He sees him every other weekend and since the divorce. He says he wasn't being the parent Harley needed, allowing him to do things he wouldn't have before, like street luge.

'''Jennifer Parker''' is a patient who came into the ER with abdominal pain while pregnant.



Jennifer came into the ER. April said it just seemed like a cold, but Jennifer said her stomach hurt really badly when she coughed or sneezed or sometimes when she moved. April went to do a more thorough exam and Jennifer admitted she was pregnant, so April had Arizona paged. She hadn't had any prenatal care for her pregnancy. Jenny was shocked when her mom arrived at the hospital and said her mother didn't know she was pregnant. April promised not to tell her, but offered to help her tell her mother herself. Jenny was worried about her mother's reaction to the pregnancy.

Jenny's mother, [[Tara Parker]], came over to her bedside, having tracked Jenny's phone to find her at the hospital. They avoided telling her Jenny was pregnant and took her for a CT.

The CT revealed a splenic artery aneurysm, but they said the bleeding had stopped. Jenny was given the option for surgery to prevent it from bleeding again but she didn't want to tell her mom she was pregnant, so she decided to watch and wait instead.

They told Tara about what Jenny had decided, but she wanted to know what the doctors thought. Arizona admitted that she recommended surgery, so Tara said she wanted the surgery. April mentioned risks and then said she could lose the baby if she had surgery, revealing that Jenny was pregnant

Tara confronted Jenny about the baby and keeping it from her. Jenny said she knew that she had ruined her mother's life, because her mother had spent her whole life telling her not to repeat her mistakes.

During an exam, Jenny's pressure bottomed out. Arizona did an ultrasound and determined that the aneurysm had ruptured, so she was rushed into surgery. In surgery, they had to remove her spleen to stop the bleeding.

Jenny was stable and awake after her surgery. Tara came to her and said that she should have told her instead of suffering and being scared alone. ''("[[I Wear the Face]]")''


When she was  weeks pregnant, Jenny slipped and fell while doing dishes. Her mother rushed her to the ER, where they said the baby looked good, but there was free fluid in her abdomen. When they determined that the fluid was amniotic fluid, [[Norman Russo|Dr. Norman Russo]] initially wanted to delivery the baby immediately, but ultimately decided to fix the leak with a plasma patch, to give Jenny more time.

He observed Jenny overnight and the next day, when her mean pressure was down, he decided he needed to deliver. However, after he opened her uterus, Arizona Robbins came into the OR and took over, instead filling her uterus with lactated ringers and sewing her back up to give the baby more time to grow.

Jenny was stable after her surgery. ''("[[Mama Tried]]")''



Her mother put a lot of pressure on her to do well and not make the same mistakes she had, one of which was getting pregnant with Jenny at age . Jenny believed her mother saw her as a mistake.


*She was  at the time of her pregnancy.
*She was in room  during her second hospitalization.<ref>[[Mama Tried]], x</ref>

'''Jerry''' is a patient who was still in the hospital five days after a bowel resection because he hadn't had a bowel movement.


Jerry had had a bowel resection and five days later, he still hadn't had a bowel movement. He was upset by this and wondered if they had botched the surgery, despite being told it was a success. He said that his life had been hard, but he'd always had the pleasure of being able to crap like clockwork, though now that had been taken away from him.

Even after being given a laxative, Jerry still hadn't had a bowel movement. In order to encourage him to follow directions to get himself discharged, they put him in the same room as [[Harriet]], who'd had a face lift. When the doctors came to check on them later, they found them in bed together, having sex.



Ex-Spouses
He's been divorced twice.

[[Harriet]]
After being put in the same room as Harriet, the two ended up having sex.


His children don't talk to him.


*He's battled addictions.
*He once filed for bankruptcy.

'''Jess''' is one of the parents whose baby was in the NICU during the super storm.


During the super storm, the NICU was partially evacuated. However, when the last rig to go out got stuck before leaving the parking lot, they kept the rest of the babies in place in the NICU. When the batteries on their ventilators started to die and no backup batteries were available, the doctors quietly stepped in and manually ventilated the infants. However, when [[Tim (Perfect Storm)|Tim]] alerted the parents to the fact that the batteries were dying, they began to panic. However, [[Derek Shepherd]] and [[Arizona Robbins]] were able to calm them down and teach them how to ventilate their own babies so there would be enough hands to save all of them.



She has a child who was in the NICU at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] during the super storm.

'''Jess''' is the girlfriend of [[Brian Weston]]. She came to the hospital to support him when he was having surgery.



When Brian was , he booked an appointment with [[Alex Karev]] to find out how old he had to be to start his sex reassignment. Alex referred him to a transgender support group, where he met Jess.

At , Brian came back to the hospital after saving up for the last four years to have his breasts removed. Jess came to the hospital to support him. On the other hand, Mr. Weston was highly unsupportive and felt that Brian would change his mind.

The surgery went well. Jess talked to Mr. Weston afterward and admitted that she had sent the e-mail informing him about the surgery because she believed he should know. He offered her all the money he had on him to help out with their rent, but left without speaking to Brian.



Jess met her boyfriend [[Brian Weston]] at a transgender support group. She says that when Brian walked in the first time, all she could think was that he was so cute.


*She is a sophomore at the University of Washington.

'''Jessica Smithson''' was a little girl who had Tay-Sachs.


Jessica was born with Tay-Sachs. By the time she was six, she was nearing the end of her life. Jessica had a seizure and was having trouble breathing. They rose up her bed and got her breathing stabilized. [[Arizona Robbins]] talked to her father, Matt, and said that this was the end of the road. He insisted that they just needed a little more time so that he could get her to Mexico for an experimental treatment. He left the hospital to try to put the money together to get her to Mexico. When Jessica woke up, she asked where her dad was, saying she wanted him. Bailey saw that she was scared and so she rocked Jessica with her like she rocked her own son when he was scared. When Jessica fell asleep, Bailey put her back in her hospital bed and lay next to her. Her father came in and told her they were going to Mexico. She asked if they could go tomorrow because she was tired. Bailey tried to get him to trade places with her, but he was still trying to get the money together to go to Mexico.

He came back to the hospital and Bailey got him to understand that he needed to stop and hold his daughter while she died.



Her father didn't want to face the reality that she was dying and frantically tried to extend her life by getting her to Mexico for an experimental treatment. Bailey and Arizona finally got him to understand that she was dying and he held her while she died.


*She was  at the time of her death.

'''Jill Taylor''' is the wife of [[Barry Taylor]].


Jill's husband, Barry, had advanced pancreatic cancer. Bailey planned to perform a whipple on him. However, Ellis took over the case as an opportunity to show off her technique. However, she ignored the fact that Barry had deep vein thrombosis, meaning that his iliac veins were not suitable for grafting. She had to cut into his neck to graft his renal vein instead. As he went to retrieve the graft, Alex was splattered with blood and noted that he may have nicked the carotid artery. Ellis was able to finish the surgery successfully despite her embarrassment.



She is married to [[Barry Taylor]], who had a whipple to treat pancreatic cancer.

He is married to [[Kelly (Push)|Kelly]].


He has a son, Noah. When Noah was hospitalized, he was very worried about him and worried about the possibility of it happening again.

'''Jim Walker''' is the father of [[Brad Walker]].


Jim came into the hospital with his son, Brad, when Brad had severe, intermittent abdominal pain. When his tests were negative, [[Alex Karev]] and [[Arizona Robbins]] wanted to run an exploratory laparoscopy. Jim initially refused, believing that Brad was faking his pain, but when Alex told him that Brad could die if he had what they thought he did, his parents agreed.

Brad was moved to the ICU after surgery and his parents were angry that the laparoscopy hadn't shown anything. However, Brad started bleeding from his chest and had to be rushed into surgery. He had a ruptured aortic arch dissection which was the cause of his pain.

Brad's surgery was successful and his parents were told he was doing fine. However, they were still angry that the doctors hadn't caught the problem earlier. Alex Karev confronted him, saying that if they'd taken Brad home like they wanted, he would have died.



He is married to [[Dina Walker]].


When his son, Brad, complained of severe, intermittent abdominal pain, Jim didn't believe him and wanted to refuse the tests the doctors wanted to do. However, he was convinced to agree and Brad turned out to have a very serious problem with his heart.

'''Jordan''' came into the ER after being in a car accident on his way to his college graduation.


While on their way to their college graduation, [[Becca Wells]], [[David Simons]], Jordan, Michelle, Pete, and Dana were in a car accident. Jordan was brought to the ER. He started to stabilize and was ready to get a CT. However, when his girlfriend was brought in dead, he coded in the ER and was unable to be resuscitated.



He was dating Dana. He tried to break it off with her before graduation, knowing he'd have to leave soon afterward, but it didn't matter. They couldn't stay away from each other. When he saw that Dana was dead, he was devastated.


He said his parents didn't have the money to let him stay in the US after graduation, which is why he had to return to Argentina.


He rode to graduation with several of his friends. They all died except [[Becca Wells]].

'''Julie''' is a woman who went on a date with [[Arizona Robbins]].


After Arizona turned down Callie's invitation for a date, she went on a date with Julie. While they were out, Callie interrupted the date to challenge Arizona's rejection of her date. They presumably did not go out again as Arizona started dating Callie soon afterward.



Julie went on a date with [[Arizona Robbins]]. Their date was crashed by [[Callie Torres]], whom Arizona began dating shortly after.

}}'''Julie Hall''' was diagnosed during pregnancy with vasa previa, for which she needed fetal surgery.


Julie and her husband wanted a baby, but had trouble conceiving. After two years of fertility treatments, however, Julie was finally pregnant. Unfortunately, she was diagnosed with vasa previa during pregnancy and fetal surgery was planned to correct the problem.

Before she could be taken in for surgery, Julie's blood pressure dropped and she started bleeding. There was no detectable fetal heartbeat, so they did a crash c-section in her hospital room. Despite their best efforts, her baby did not survive.



[[File:xJulieHallHusband.png|thumb|px|left]]
Julie is married to a man named Mark. They had trouble conceiving, but after  years of fertility treatments, Julie was pregnant.


Julie was diagnosed with vasa previa during her pregnancy, endangering her life and the life of her baby. Fetal surgery was planned, but before she could be taken in, she became unstable and there was bleeding and no fetal heartbeat. They delivered her baby, but it was too late.

'''Karla''' is the mother of [[Nico]].


Karla drove her son, [[Nico]], over to his girlfriend, [[Clementine|Clementine's]] house and gave her a box of peanut clusters, not knowing that Clem is allergic to peanuts. When Clem had an allergic reaction, Karla and Nico went with Clem to the ER. Nico insisted on staying with Clem all day. When Karla insisted that Nico go home when Clem was told she'd have to stay overnight, he threw a fit and only agreed to go home when [[Alex Karev|Alex]] told him he'd deliver a message for him.



Karla's son, Nico, has a girlfriend named [[Clementine]]. When she had an allergic reaction to the peanut clusters Karla bought her for Valentine's Day, Karla had to go along with Nico and Clem to the ER. She also mentioned having two other children.


Karla mentioned having a busy job as the reason why she couldn't read the school newsletters, which stated that Clem was allergic to peanuts.


*She does not get along with [[Clementine|Clem's]] mother, [[Terri (All You Need is Love)|Terri]].

}}
'''Kathy''' is the sister of [[Danny]].


Kathy was raising her younger brother, Danny, after the deaths of their parents.

At some point in his past, Danny received a liver transplant. Later, his body started to reject that liver, so he was in the hospital waiting for another liver to become available for transplant. [[Alex Karev]] took the case to [[Meredith Grey]] to look for more treatment options. She examined Danny and decided that she wanted to rebuild his biliary tree, which would prevent further infections and give him more time to wait for a transplant and would even allow him to go home while he waited. Danny wanted the surgery, but Kathy was scared of the risks.

When Danny's conditioned worsened, he again insisted that he wanted the surgery. Kathy admitted that he was almost an adult and had very little control over his own life, so she agreed to do what he wanted and Danny had the surgery. In surgery, he had a lot of bleeding, so Meredith put in a shunt, but the anastomosis leaked. They tried to repair the damage, but despite their best efforts, Danny died in the OR. When they told Kathy, she was devastated to hear of his death.



After the deaths of their parents, Kathy took over raising her younger brother, Danny. She said she'd spent her whole adult life taking care of him and said he was her whole life. When he died, she was devastated.


*She got a hockey puck signed for her brother, who was a hockey fan.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Kathy}}

'''Kelly''' is the mother of [[Noah]].


Kelly came to the hospital when her son, Noah, collapsed at the zoo. She and her husband were both upset because of what happened, each of them trying to find out who was to blame. [[Arizona Robbins]] assured them that it wasn't helping. Noah ended up having surgery after a cyst on his liver was found to have ruptured. The surgery was successful and his parents were told he'd be okay afterward. There was a chance he could develop more cysts, but they were prepared and knew what to look for.



She is married to [[Jim (Push)|Jim]]. She worried that he thought Noah's hospitalization was her fault.


She has a son, Noah. When Noah was hospitalized, she was very worried about him and worried about the possibility of it happening again.

'''Kelly Roesch''' is a patient who had surgery to treat her constant blushing.


Kelly had a condition that caused her to blush heavily every time she was embarrassed. She hated it because it made it impossible to hide her feelings, including the fact that she had a crush on her surgeon, [[Derek Shepherd]]. Because of this, she decided to have a procedure to stop the blushing despite the risks of the surgery.

After surgery, Kelly woke up and was delighted not to feel herself blushing when Derek's name was said.



She had a crush on Derek Shepherd that was made extremely obvious by her condition. She blushed heavily every time his name was mentioned.


*She was  at the time of her surgery.

'''Ken Danzinger''' is the father of [[Brian Danzinger]], a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].



Brian came into the ER after passing out in first period English with severe abdominal pain, tremors, and hypertension. He denied drug use. His abdomen was rigid and his hair was falling out. They sedated him and his BP went down. Scans revealed a hemorrhaging liver mass. They informed the parents that his symptoms were consistent with the use of anabolic steroids. The parents confronted him and he admitted that he'd been doing steroids because he wanted girls to like him and he believes they only like guys with crazy bodies. He tried to claim that he'd barely taken any, but his mother said it had been two years, since his sophomore year, as that's when he'd stopped being her baby. They took him into the OR and biopsied the mass. Pathology confirmed that he had liver cancer, but they got it all when they resected the mass. His parents were warned that it could recur if he continued to do steroids. His father insisted that he wouldn't.



He is married to [[Dorie Danzinger]] and they have a son, [[Brian Danzinger]].


His son, Brian, was hospitalized for symptoms of steroid use, including liver cancer. When informed that the symptoms could recur if he continued to use steroids, his father insisted that he wouldn't.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Danzinger, Ken}}

'''Ken May''' is the father of [[Hayley May]].


Ken came to the hospital with his daughter, Hayley, whom they were trying to commit to the psychiatric ward after she was diagnosed with schizophrenia. When she tried to claw her eyes out, she had to be cleared by surgery first. Alex suspected she didn't actually have schizophrenia and convinced her parents to agree to let him run more tests. He was given four hours to find an alternate diagnosis. He did some research and believed she had superior canal dehiscence syndrome. Her diagnosis was confirmed and she had surgery to repair the defect. The surgery was successful.



He is married to [[Mary May]].


His father was schizophrenic and killed himself when Ken was eight. His daughter, Hayley, was also diagnosed with schizophrenia, though her diagnosis was incorrect.

'''Kevin Platt''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Kevin was in the hospital due to short gut syndrome. He was receiving TPN while he waited for his STEP procedure to lengthen his bowel.


The STEP Procedure was originally scheduled to be performed by [[Arizona Robbins|Dr. Robbins]], but [[Alex Karev]], who had previously worked on his case, convinced Kevin's parents to switch the case to him so he could operate. He operated, assisted by Dr. Robbins, and the procedure went well.


*The interrupting jellyfish joke is his favorite.

'''Kim Cole''' is the mother of [[Jared Cole]], a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Kim's son, Jared, has Byler's Disease, which caused him to be severely jaundiced and put him at risk for liver failure. He was in the hospital to have a biliary diversion which would allow the bile to drain out of his abdomen.

The initial plan was to use part of his intestine to make the stoma, but [[Alex Karev]] had the idea to use his appendix instead, removing the need to cut into his healthy intestine. The surgery was successful and after surgery, Jared\us skin was a more normal color.



[[Jared Cole]]
Kim has a son, Jared, who was hospitalized due to his Byler's Disease.

'''Kim Dawson''' was [[Callie Torres|Callie]] and [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona's]] marriage counselor.


When Callie and Arizona agreed to go to marriage counseling, they saw Dr. Dawson for that. She taught them specific words to use to communicate with each other in a productive way. She suggested that they take a break, living in the same house, trading off child care, but without talking or having sex, with each other or with other people. Callie was initially reluctant, but agreed when Arizona pushed for it. They continued to have individual sessions with Dawson during those  days. When they broke the rules and kissed, she had them reset the counter and go for  days from that point. At the end of the  days, they had a joint session in which Callie said that the  days made her realize that they needed to love themselves and Sofia for a while, rather than each other.


She is a marriage counselor in [[Seattle]].

'''Kondo''' is one of the kids who came to Seattle from Africa to have surgery.


Kondo came to Seattle from Africa to have surgery because he had Pentalogy of Cantrell and a ventricular septal defect. Because his skin had grown directly on his heart, they had to separate that carefully and then [[Mark Sloan]] built him a new sternum to protect his heart. His surgery went well.



He has several sisters, but only one brother, [[Sefu]]. They are very close and Sefu was worried he was going to lose Kondo during his surgery.

'''Kyle Baker''' is the son of [[Allison Baker]] who had a cystic hygroma on his neck.


Kyle came into the hospital with his mother, who was a participant in Derek's Alzheimer's trial. While his mother was being examined before her surgery, Meredith noticed a bump on Kyle's neck. He'd had it for a while and they had meant to get it checked out but hadn't had the time due to his mother's condition. Meredith had April Kepner examine him and after seeing his scans, Arizona Robbins diagnosed a cystic hygroma, which needed to be removed immediately because it was starting to close off his airway. [[Robert Stark]] also saw his scans and wanted to call child protective services on the parents for letting it go for so long. However, April convinced him not to call by saying that they'd have the parents bring Kyle in every time his mother had a follow-up for the trial and she'd exam him personally to make sure his health was being attended.



Kyle's mother has Alzheimer's disease. He did a large part of taking care of her, feeding her lunch and singing Johnny Cash to her to calm her down.


*He was ten at the time of his surgery.

'''Kyra Marshall''' was a patient of [[Erica Hahn|Dr. Hahn]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].



Kyra had a history of end-stage cardiomyopathy and COPD, so she was awaiting a heart transplant at Seattle Grace. Her antibody levels were so elevated, she was in danger of rejecting a donor heart, so she was given high levels of chemotherapy to suppress the immune system. As a result, she had to be kept in isolation to avoid infection. Dr. Hahn had said that she would have a heart within three weeks, but it was over eight before Erica had found her one.

Right before her transplant, her lung collapsed. She was saved by [[Alex Karev]], who broke the isolation to treat her. Unfortunately for her, the exposure to the outside put her at further risk of infection and her heart transplant was pushed back, though her family was put in [[scrubs]] and allowed to come touch her.



She is married to [[Lucas Marshall]].


She has two daughters, [[Zoe Marshall|Zoe]] and [[Jessie Marshall|Jessie]], with her husband.


*In order to protect her little girls, she skipped over the scary parts in fairy tales, such as when Snow White dies (which Alex accidentally reveals).

{{DEFAULTSORT:Marshall, Kyra}}

'''Laura''' is the first girlfriend of [[Alex Karev]].


Back in , Laura was dating Alex Karev. She used studying for a test as an excuse to come over to Alex's house and spend time with him. While they were hanging out, his mother came through the room, confused and believing there were aliens in the house trying to get her. Laura watched as Alex restrained her and gave her her medication, which she had forgotten to take that morning.

Later, Alex went to a party, where he overheard Laura telling her friends about what had happened and how weird it was. She wanted to end things, but hadn't done it yet.



She dated [[Alex Karev]] while they were in high school.

'''Laura Young''' came into the ER pregnant after her unborn baby had a stroke.


Laura was  weeks pregnant when she was in a car accident. She had a subdural hematoma and her baby was in distress. They took her in for surgery, during which her baby was delivered via c-section.

Her surgery went well, but her ICP was elevated the next day. She was also worried about her baby, saying she could die before she'd even been held. Laura then had a seizure.

[[Alex Karev]] held the baby and her condition improved. Laura's condition also improved and she was finally able to hold her own daughter.



Laura's daughter had a stroke before she was born when Laura was in a car accident. The baby was delivered via emergency c-section. Laura was concerned because she worried that the baby would die before she got a chance to be held. When Laura and the baby were stable enough that Laura could hold her, she commented that her baby was beautiful.

'''Laurel Pinson''' is a first-year medical student who toured the hospital.

She remembered seeing him on Seattle Med and was interested in the work he'd done on [[Lily Price]]. Throughout the day, he engaged her in what he was doing and gave her several opportunities to learn. As a result, he was the only resident to get a positive evaluation.

At the end of the day, he took her home and slept with her.



She slept with Alex after observing him for a day.


*She's interested in regenerative medicine.
