|count = 
|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Hilarie Burton]]
}}'''Lauren Boswell''' is a [[Craniofacial Surgery|craniofacial surgeon]]\uawho once consulted\uaon a case at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. She worked closely together with\ua[[Arizona Robbins|Dr. Arizona Robbins]], whom she showed romantic interest\uain and whom she eventually ended up having a one-night stand with.



When Lauren ordered coffee at a coffee cart, Arizona accidentally took Lauren's coffee as she didn't look up while taking it. However, Lauren did notice it and took Arizona's coffee. After flirting briefly with Arizona, Lauren left with Arizona's coffee.


Lauren was in [[Seattle]] to work on the case of [[Tyler Sims]], who had an encephalocele. She planned to operate on him with [[Jackson Avery]] and [[Arizona Robbins]]. ''("[[Do You Believe in Magic]]")''

The surgery went well. Lauren coached Arizona and Jackson through most of it and Tyler's parents were informed that he'd only be left with a small scar on his forehead. ''("[[Readiness is All]]")''


After their first day working together on the Tyler Sims case, Lauren and Arizona met up in an elevator. Lauren began to flirt with Arizona until Arizona interrupted, saying that she's happily married and noting that Lauren had met her wife and that she only had one leg. Lauren says that she knows that already, as there's only one Arizona Robbins on the internet. ''("[[Do You Believe in Magic]]")''

As they prepared for Tyler's surgery, Lauren continued to flirt with Arizona, even suggesting they get coffee before the surgery. After Tyler's surgery, Lauren asked Arizona to show her to an on-call room, so she could sleep nearby the first night after surgery. However, once they were in the room and Arizona tried to say goodbye, the power went out and they began to kiss. Arizona initially pulled away, reiterating that she's married. But Lauren told her that she is allowed to lose a little bit of control and Arizona leaned back in and they started to kiss again. ''("[[Readiness is All]]")''

After the power came back on in the hospital, Callie came to find Arizona and saw Arizona talking to Lauren. She noticed that Arizona's wedding ring was pinned to the scrub top Lauren was wearing. Despite Lauren coming up with a lie, Callie figured out what had happened. ''("[[Perfect Storm]]")''


Despite being told by Arizona to stay in the on-call room, Lauren came back to the NICU, where only two nurses had made it in for their shifts, leaving them understaffed. Lauren helped bag and manually ventilate the babies in the NICU. ''("[[Perfect Storm]]")''


After the storm ended, the airport reopened and Jackson put her in a cab so she could catch her plane.\ua''("[[Seal Our Fate]]")''


During her brief time at Grey Sloan Memorial, she displayed a playful, flirty disposition, openly flirting with Arizona. She was also highly encouraging toward Jackson. She took a collaborative approach to the surgical case, allowing Arizona to take a part of the surgery and encouraging Jackson to take another part. Jackson remarked that Lauren was similar to Mark in her ability to mentor in a way that made him feel capable. She openly admitted to being a control freak, but sees this as a positive quality.



[[Arizona Robbins]]
When she arrived at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], she took an immediate liking to Arizona and flirted with her. Despite learning via Google search that Arizona was married and had lost her leg, she continued to pursue Arizona. After the surgery on Tyler is completed, she asks Arizona to show her an [[On-Call Room|on-call room]]. She and Arizona have sex. After a stressful day in the [[Neonatal Intensive Care Unit|NICU]], Lauren told Arizona she had feelings for her, saying, "I'm not just gonna leave things like this... I like you. A lot." However, Arizona told Lauren that she had made a mistake, effectively ending their relationship, even before Callie finds out.


Dr. Lauren Boswell is a [[Board Certification|board certified]] [[Plastic Surgery|plastic surgeon]] specializing in [[Craniofacial Surgery|craniofacial surgery]]. She is considered one of the best in her field, as she flies around the world to assist other surgeons.

She acted as a [[Attending|consulting surgeon]] on a [[Pediatric Surgery|pediatric]] [[Plastic Surgery|plastic surgery]] case at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], assisting [[Arizona Robbins|Dr. Arizona Robbins]] and [[Jackson Avery|Dr. Jackson Avery]].


*Although a consulting surgeon from another hospital, Dr. Boswell was issued her own embroidered [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] lab coat.
*She likes to oversee prep on her surgeries.

'''Lauren Hammer''' is a patient who came out with an infection after she killed off the good bacteria in her gut.


Lauren came into the ER complaining of stomach pain. She'd looked up her symptoms on the internet and was convinced that she had stomach cancer. Alex took a stool sample. She admitted that she'd ordered antibiotics to treat a staph infection she'd diagnosed in herself. The antibiotics killed off all the healthy bacteria, so they needed to introduced new healthy bacteria. This required a fecal transplant from someone she shared everyday germs with. Her husband refused to donate until she would admit that it was a pimple, not a staph infection. She was only able to say that she believed that he believed it was just a pimple. She said that she's still convinced it's stomach cancer. Every minor thing, she thinks is a big thing. He finally agreed to provide the sample and she received a transplant with him waiting in the lobby.



She is married to [[Seth Hammer]].

{{DEFAULTSORT:Hammer, Lauren}}

'''Laurie Kiefer''' is a patient who gave birth to twins who both had liver tumors.


Laurie and her husband, Mason, were expecting twins. They decided not to know the sexes of the babies. Laurie went into labor while her OB was on vacation, so [[Arizona Robbins]] stepped in to deliver the babies, but before delivery, she noticed something odd on the ultrasound. She had [[Alex Karev]] paged urgently and delivered the babies, who were both severely jaundiced. The babies were then taken to CT, where it was revealed that each of them had a large liver tumor.

The doctors informed Mason and Laurie of the situation and they decided to be tested to see if either of them was a match and could donate. Mason was a match, but Laurie was not, meaning they could only save one baby. They worried about how they would choose until Alex stepped in and said that they wouldn't have to choose; he'd be making the choice. He ran tests and compared their conditions, but the twins came out tied, so he decided that he needed to open both of them up and look directly at their tumors before he could make the choice. After the twins were opened, he evaluated each of them again and decided that Emma had a better chance, so she received the liver, while he tried resecting Daniel's tumor. Emma immediately started to improve after her surgery, but Daniel unfortunately died during his.



She is married to [[Mason Kiefer]]. Together, they have two children.


Her twin children, Emma and Daniel, were both born with aggressive liver tumors. Her husband matched as a donor, but was only able to give enough of his liver to save one. Emma received a portion of his liver and Daniel died.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Kiefer, Laurie}}

'''Lebo''' is a woman who was pregnant with a baby who attached to her colon instead of her uterus.


Lebo had come to Seattle with her sister, [[Abena]], in order to get Abena a surgery she needed. After a month, Abena was ready to go home, but as they were leaving the hospital, Lebo collapsed in severe abdominal pain. They took her into the ER, where they found out she was pregnant. She hadn't told them because she was worried they'd say she couldn't fly and she needed to be there with her sister. She had blood in her abdomen from what they believed was a splenic rupture, so they took her into surgery. They opened her up, but there was no rupture on her spleen, so they looked for other causes. While they were looking in her intestines, they found her baby, who had implanted there because of scarring on her fallopian tubes. Lucy stepped in and delivered the baby and then said they needed to remove as much of the placenta as they could, as it was the cause of the bleeding. After her surgery, she and the baby were both stable, though Alex was concerned about their ability to get follow-up visits.



She came to Seattle with her sister. She didn't tell the doctors she was pregnant because she was worried they'd tell her she couldn't fly.

When her son was born, she was told he was healthy despite attaching to her intestines instead of her uterus.


*She was  at the time of her son's birth.

'''Lily Price''' is a girl who had a tracheal tumor that had grown and blocked off her air supply.


Lily had a tumor in her trachea. The tumor was benign, but was blocking her airway, making it hard for her to breathe. She'd had surgeries to remove it in the past, but it kept growing back. When she stopped breathing in the hospital, they tried a bronchoscope, but it didn't work, so they had to do a percutaneous tracheotomy, which allowed her to breathe again. Then they took her into the OR to put in a trach.

Lily's scans revealed that in order to remove her tumor again, they'd have to remove her trachea, which would leave her completely unable to breathe. They later found another option. They placed a stent to help her breathe for a while and then removed cartilage from a rib to help grow her a new trachea, so they could implant a trachea made from her own tissue when they had to remove hers. They grew the trachea in a lab for a while and then put it in her abdomen to let it continue to grow until it was ready.

After her surgery, she was asked what the best part of her experience was. She brought [[Alex Karev]] to her class to speak.



Lily's mother was only able to visit her a few times a week because they lived three hours away.


*She was nine at the time of her surgery.
*She and her mom live more than three hours away from the hospital.
*Her teacher is Ms. McKee, an obvious reference to writer [[Stacy McKee]].

'''Lindsay McNeil''' is the mother of [[Drew McNeil]].


Lindsay's son, Drew, was in the hospital after pectus excavatum surgery. He had a lot of pain, so she called for a doctor. Meredith examined him and agreed to page Stark. Stark came in, but dismissed the pain as gas. When an antiflatulent didn't relieve his pain, Meredith ran more tests. While they were waiting for a CT, Lindsay called The Chief, having worked the system to get his home phone number. He came in and got things moving. The CT revealed a perforated ulcer, so Drew was taken back into surgery, though Meredith and Alex were forced to operate themselves when Stark didn't answer his pages.



She is very protective of her son, Drew.


She is a nurse at [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]].

'''Lisa Collis''' is an infant who needed a liver transplant due to biliary atresia.


Lisa was born with biliary atresia and was in the hospital awaiting a liver transplant. When she was four months old, a liver became available. Because the donor was an adult, the liver was split between herself and another patient. The transplant went well, but they were unable to close because of the swelling. Stark placed a sponge to keep the pressure off her hepatic artery and took her out of surgery.

The sponge was at risk for causing infection, so it wasn't a permanent solution to keep the pressure off. Alex had the idea to use a sterilized ping pong ball, which was safer because it could stay in her body and her liver would just grow around it. Stark operated to place it and after surgery, her parents were able to see her.



Lisa's parents were concerned for her safety and did research into liver transplants before Lisa's surgery so they could be prepared. They were also insistent that she be called by her name because they read it helps you bond wth the baby.


*She was four months old at the time of her liver transplant.

'''Liza Simmons''' is a woman who collapsed at the hospital due to a tumor on her placenta.


Liza came into the ER with her friends, [[Cleo Kim|Cleo]] and [[Gregory Williams|Greg]] when they were injured in a roller coaster derailment. Cleo blamed her because Liza had told Cleo to go on the ride so she could live vicariously through her, because she was pregnant and couldn't ride herself. While she was waiting for news on Cleo and Greg, Liza collapsed in the waiting room. An ultrasound showed a tumor on her placenta. She was taken into surgery to remove it in an attempt to delay premature delivery, but her baby, [[Jasper Simmons|Jasper]], became bradycardic, so Arizona was forced to deliver him at  weeks. After delivery, he was given oxygen, which stabilized him enough that Liza was able to see him for a few minutes before he was taken to the NICU.



She had a baby, [[Jasper Simmons]], alone.


She is friends with fellow residents, [[Gregory Williams]] and [[Cleo Kim]]. When Greg said they had to do more than just work all the same, they went to a carnival together, which ended poorly when the roller coaster derailed.


She is a second-year [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Resident|resident]] at [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]].


*[[Gregory Williams]] was supposed to be her birthing partner.

'''Lori Bosson''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] who developed aphasia after [[Lexie Grey]] and [[Meredith Grey]] removed a tumor against the surgical plan developed by [[Derek Shepherd]].



Lori was admitted to SGMW to have surgery to drain a cyst on her brain. Derek also found a tumor, but decided to leave it as it was not causing Lori any problems and could be removed at a later date if needed.

Having been on Derek's service for some time, Derek assigned Lexie the task of draining the cyst. Having left Derek's service following her tampering with his clinic trial, Derek had forgiven Meredith and invited her back to work with him again in neurosurgery and wanted her on Lori\us procedure.

Under Derek's supervision, Lexie performed the craniotomy and cyst drainage perfectly. However Derek got called away by Alex for a consultation on [[Morgan Peterson|Intern Morgan\us]] premature baby, leaving Meredith and Lexie alone with Lori. After noticing some bleeding, Meredith instructed Lexie to enlarge the craniotomy to find the source. Upon finding the source of the bleed and cauterizing it, they uncovered the site of the tumor. The tumor had clear margins and its removal appeared straightforward. Despite Meredith having doubts that they should remove it without Derek knowing, she eventually prompted Lexie to remove it. After they had finished, Meredith went to find Derek and reported what they had done and that it had went well. Instead of being pleased, Derek was furious, saying that Lori had not consented to tumor removal.

Meredith reassured Derek that Lori would be fine. Upon waking up from the surgery, she was responsive to visual stimuli. However, when she tried to speak, she could do little more than make terrified groans. Derek diagnosed Lori as suffering from Aphasia, a condition in which a patient can understand speech and form sentences in their brain, but renders them unable to physically form words. This was due to the fact that 'Broca's Area' in Lori's brain had been damaged by the tumor removal and was ultimately irreversible. Despite Meredith protesting that she had told Lexie to remove the tumor and that it was her fault, Derek took responsibility. Lori's parents said that they were going to sue him.

Upon hearing of Lori's condition, Lexie was devastated. Meredith comforted her saying that she had to go and see Derek who would be very angry and would yell and scream. However, she would take it in and never make a mistake like that again.


Lori is a positive and cheerful patient. She seemed pleased by the fact that Lexie was doing the procedure and cheered her on.



Lori's parents came to the hospital after her surgery. They were delighted when she woke up, but saddened when she was unable to speak normally.


Lori had just finished law school when she discovered that she had a cyst. She figured this out because she got dizzy during a job interview.


*She was  at the time of her surgery.

'''Lucinda Gamble''' is a lawyer whom both April and Arizona consulted.



April consulted with Lucinda when she had a restraining order against Jackson, believing he was fighting for sole custody. Lucinda was sure Jackson would be trying for full custody once the baby was born, because that's what she'd advise April to do in his shoes. Whether she meant it or not, she started an arms race with the restraining order. April said she wanted to take it back, but Lucinda advised her not to talk to Jackson and to let the order stand. She just wanted to keep her baby safe. Lucinda said they could use her feeling that her baby was in danger. ''("[[It's Alright, Ma (I'm Only Bleeding)]]")''


When Arizona learned that Callie was moving to New York with Penny and taking Sofia with her, she went to Lucinda, who said that in custody battles, even if you win, you feel like you've lost something, so she wanted to know that Arizona was sure she wanted to fight. Arizona said she was sure. ''("[[It's Alright, Ma (I'm Only Bleeding)]]")''


Lucinda and Callie's lawyer, [[Michelle Carpio]], tried to mediate over the phone. However, they were unable to reach a peaceful agreement, so they were forced to take it to court.


The case went to court, with [[Madeline Kane]] presiding.

First, Michelle questioned Owen about his work with Callie on the veterans. He said Callie was a very empathetic person. He said he didn't feel the move was sudden for Callie, because when she's presented with a challenge, she faces it.

The next person called was Andrew, who talked about living with Sofia and Arizona. He said Sofia made the house happy.

After Andrew, Penny was called. She was asked if she loved Sofia. She said she did, despite only knowing her for a few months. Despite not being able to recall what grade Sofia was in or what she'd been wearing that morning, she demonstrated knowledge of Sofia's likes and dislikes.

Michelle questioned Bailey about the differences between Arizona and Callie's work and their schedules. She presented documentation that Arizona did more emergency surgeries in the past six months than Callie had. Bailey questioned if Michelle would ask about it if Arizona were a man. Bailey said every emergency surgery was Arizona saving someone else's baby.

The next day, Michelle questioned Meredith about Sofia's friendship with Zola and her relationship to Penny. She said Sofia loves Penny. She takes easily to people if they're good people. Lucinda then questioned her about Meredith and Callie helping each other out. Lucinda emphasized that Callie had a support system in Seattle.

Next, Lucinda talked to Richard about his relationship with Arizona. He said Sofia would be lucky to have her as a role model parent. Michelle then questioned him about their trivia nights. She found documentation from the bar that said they'd won trivia night  times in the last six months.  nights Arizona was out with him, away from Sofia. Richard said he didn't know where Sofia was during those nights. Michelle presented transcripts of text messages between Callie and Arizona showing  times Arizona asked Callie to switch days with Sofia. Lucinda requested a recess.

Lucinda and Arizona talked about how they'd slut shamed her in the courtroom. Lucinda said Arizona needed to set the record straight. She assured Arizona she'd win if she told the truth.

Michelle questioned Callie about the day Sofia was born. She talked about the accident and how she wanted to give up, but couldn't because she was pregnant with Sofia at the time. She said being a mother was the reason she's alive today.

Finally, Michelle questioned Arizona about the circumstances of Sofia's conception in relation to her relationship with Callie. She insinuated that Arizona had come around later. Arizona said she legally adopted Sofia and that when the time had come to make a choice, she had chosen motherhood and it was the best choice she ever made. During this time, her phone started ringing repeatedly. She told the judge she was a doctor and needed to check her phone. When she saw it was a patient emergency, she apologized, but said she needed to leave. She loved Sofia and wanted her with her, but she knew that no matter what happened, Sofia would he happy and healthy and loved and cared for because she and Callie are her mothers. But there was a kid at the hospital who wouldn't be okay without her, so she needed to go to the hospital to save that kid.

The hearing ended with Arizona being awarded full custody of Sofia. ''("[[Mama Tried]]")''


Lucinda is a lawyer who is known to handle custody cases.


*Given the fact that she handles custody cases, she's most likely a family law lawyer. This, however, has not been confirmed.

{{Attending Infobox |image = x-.png |name = Lucy Fields |status = Alive |title = M.D. |job = *[[Attending]] [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] *[[Maternal-Fetal Medicine]] [[Fellow]] *Director |workplace = '''Current'''
Namboze Clinic
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] |first appearance = [[Don't Deceive Me (Please Don't Go)]] |last appearance = [[Unaccompanied Minor]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Rachael Taylor]] }} '''Lucy Fields''' is an [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] [[Attending|attending]] and\ua[[Maternal-Fetal Medicine|maternal-fetal medicine]] [[Fellow|fellow]] who tended to [[Callie Torres|Callie's]] pregnancy with [[Sofia Robbin Sloan Torres|Sofia]] and who later had a brief romantic liaison with [[Alex Karev]]. She left Seattle to take a job at the Namboze Clinic in Malawi. She attended [[Harvard Medical School]], completed her [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] [[Resident|residency]] at [[Duke University Medical Center|Duke]], and did a [[Fellow|fellowship]] in [[Maternal-Fetal Medicine|maternal-fetal medicine]] at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]. When [[Callie Torres]] became pregnant, Arizona selected Lucy to monitor her pregnancy. She did an ultrasound and showed Callie, [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]], and [[Mark Sloan|Mark]] the yolk sac. Callie was concerned because she was bleeding, but Lucy assured her that that's common. She agreed to run some tests, but told Callie just to live her life. However, Callie refused to leave the exam room until Lucy ruled out everything. Lucy ended up bringing up a stronger ultrasound machine, which allowed the three parents to hear the heartbeat. ''("[[Don't Deceive Me (Please Don't Go)]]")'' She did a second ultrasound on Callie later and asked if they'd scheduled an amniocentesis, which prompted a debate between the three parents over whether or not they needed one. ''("[[Not Responsible]]")'' Lucy did a third ultrasound at . weeks. She said everything looked good, but Callie's blood pressure was just a little high, though she said it was due to the nerves about her baby shower. She then invited Lucy to the baby shower. ''("[[This is How We Do It]]")'' When Alex came to the NICU looking for a brain dead infant whom the transplant coordinator had suggested as a potential donor for his patient, who had hypoplastic left-heart syndrome, he butted head with Lucy, who banned him from the NICU over his comments. She later saw him talking to his patient's parents in the NICU and wanted to go kick him out, but Arizona told her that Alex is a good guy and a good doctor, even if he can be an ass sometimes. ''("[[P.Y.T. (Pretty Young Thing)]]")'' When Lucy found out that Alex needed to sign his delinquent charts to get out of the hospital in time for a basketball game, she helped him get through the charts because she didn't want him to miss the game. After they were finished, he asked her to go to the game with him, but she declined. She later watched from the gallery as he skipped the game to treat a four year old. ''("[[Golden Hour]]")'' When Meredith's vision started to become blurry due to her fertility medications, Alex came and talked to Lucy about it. She correctly figured out that he was just looking for an excuse to talk to her, because if Meredith were really concerned, she'd come to Lucy herself. When Meredith's condition worsened, she did come to Lucy, who examined her and told her to stop taking the drugs immediately and got a consult from an ophthalmologist. ''("[[Not Responsible]]")'' Lucy came to Callie's baby shower, where she noticed that Alex was stealing party food and asked him about it. Later, she asked Meredith about Alex and she told Lucy about some of the things Alex had been through, saying the neanderthal act was just a front. ''("[[This is How We Do It]]")'' When Callie and Arizona were a car accident when Callie was . weeks pregnant, Lucy was called in to monitor the pregnancy as they worked on Callie. She was able to find a fetal heartbeat in the ER, but when she admitted that she was out of her depth, they called in [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]]. Lucy was embarrassed at having been benched. ''("[[Song Beneath the Song]]")'' Lucy was supposed to go to Callie and Arizona's wedding as Alex's date, but a baby she was delivering got stuck and so she couldn't make it. ''("[[White Wedding]]")'' She got a job over other applicants at Baylor in Texas. She was hesitant to take it, thinking about spending another year in Seattle. She mentioned there were a lot of factors to consider before taking the job, implicitly saying her relationship with Alex was one of the reasons. In surgery, Arizona mentioned to Alex that a doctor was needed to take over for her at the Namboze Clinic, and that he was qualified to do it. Lucy overheard the offer and got interested. Upon hearing Alex was interested too, she found out that she wasn't a factor that he took into consideration. After a talk with Arizona, Alex realized that he loved Lucy and that she was an important factor. By that time, Lucy had already taken the job at Namboze, stating career comes first. ''("[[I Will Survive]]")'' Lucy was part of the team of doctors to tend to victims of a plane crash. However, all but one died in the crash, so she delivered the news of their deaths to several victims' families. At the end of the day, she went to look for Alex at Joe's bar and asked him to tell her not to go to Africa. Feeling bad over getting Meredith fired, he was drinking and simply told her to go to hell.\ua''("[[Unaccompanied Minor]]")'' When Cristina realized she hadn't had a period in a while, she went to Lucy, who did an ultrasound and said it looked like she was about six weeks pregnant. She asked if Cristina wanted to talk about options, but Cristina said she didn't. ''("[[Unaccompanied Minor]]")'' [[Alex Karev]] Alex met Lucy in the NICU, but thought she was a nurse. He asked her to pass him a chart on "a turnip" in the nursery. She was upset by this and he told her he had a baby that needed a heart transplant, and the transplant coordinator suggested "the turnip" as a potential donor. She then told him she delivered the baby and she'd be in touch with the transplant coordinator and then told Alex to leave. Later, Alex noticed Dr. Fields, Teddy, Arizona, and Cristina talking to the parents so he walked in and tried to join. Afterward, he asked Arizona why he wasn't brought in earlier and Lucy told him he was off the case because of the "turnip" comment. Alex and Lucy watched the heart transplant from the gallery. He explained that he was sorry for what he said, but felt he deserved to be in the surgery. Lucy watched Alex standing over the heart transplant baby and smiling with the baby's parents. Arizona told Lucy she could teach Alex not to be an ass, but she didn't have to teach him to care. At the end of the night, Alex and Lucy were in the elevator together, not speaking. Alex finally told her he was sorry about her patient. She said she was happy for his. As they walked out, he started to ask if she wanted "to get a --," but she cut him off and said no. ''("[[P.Y.T. (Pretty Young Thing)]]")'' When she heard about that Alex had charts to finish before he could go to a basketball game, she sat down to help him because she agreed he couldn't miss the game. In the end, she talked him into asking her and then claimed it was all just so she could see if he'd ask her to the game. ''("[[Golden Hour]]")'' When he came to her to get help with Meredith's vision, she correctly figured out that he was just trying to get a second chance with her, but couldn't just ask her out again after being rejected. He then asked her out, but was rejected a second time. ''("[[Not Responsible]]")'' [[File:x-.jpg|thumb|Lucy and Alex at Callie and Arizona's baby shower]] They talked again at Callie and Arizona's baby shower, where she noticed him stealing food. She asked Meredith about him and she said there's more to Alex than it seems and told Lucy about what he'd been through. At the end of the night, she joined him in his trailer in the parking lot for a drink. She figured out that he had been waiting for her. Alex tried to defend himself, but she kissed him. ''("[[This is How We Do It]]")'' She was supposed to go to Callie and Arizona's wedding with Alex, but she got stuck delivering a baby. ''("[[White Wedding]]")'' Their relationship ended when, believing Alex didn't consider her a factor in his decision of whether or not to take the job at Namboze, Lucy stepped in and took the job herself. ''("[[I Will Survive]]")'' After graduating [[Harvard Medical School]], Lucy completed an [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] [[Resident|residency]] at [[Duke University Medical Center]]. Lucy decided to complete her [[Maternal-Fetal Medicine|maternal-fetal medicine]] [[Fellow|fellowship]] at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]\uato gain OB-related trauma cases.\ua While at Seattle Grace Mercy West, Lucy did the initial exam and ultrasound for [[Callie Torres|Callie]] when she was pregnant with [[Sofia Robbin Sloan Torres|Sofia]]. Although the case was relatively boring for a maternal-fetal fellow, [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]] convinced Lucy to be Callie's OB. Lucy was also the go-to OB consult for emergent patients. Near the end of her fellowship, Lucy applied for and was accepted into a program at Baylor in Texas. She considered staying another year at Seattle Grace Mercy West, but ultimately chose to work at Namboze Clinic as its director, taking over Arizona's old position. Furthermore, Baylor, in the real world, does offer a fetal surgery fellowship. *She is a basketball fan.[[Golden Hour]], x xLucyFields.png|[[Don't Deceive Me (Please Don't Go)]] xLucyFields.png|[[P.Y.T. |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Anne-Marie Johnson]]
}}
'''Madeline Kane''' is the judge who presided over the hearing regarding custody of [[Sofia Robbin Sloan Torres]].


Madeline Kane presided over the case regarding the custody of Sofia Torres. Before they began the hearing, she asked Callie and Arizona if they were absolutely sure they wanted to proceed, something she does with all custody hearings. They both said they did.

First, [[Michelle Carpio]] questioned Owen about his work with Callie on the veterans. He said Callie was a very empathetic person. He said he didn't feel the move was sudden for Callie, because when she's presented with a challenge, she faces it.

The next person called was Andrew, who talked about living with Sofia and Arizona. He said Sofia made the house happy.

After Andrew, Penny was called. She was asked if she loved Sofia. She said she did, despite only knowing her for a few months. Despite not being able to recall what grade Sofia was in or what she'd been wearing that morning, she demontrasted knowledge of Sofia's likes and dislikes.

Michelle questioned Bailey about the differences between Arizona and Callie's work and their schedules. She presented documentation that Arizona did more emergency surgeries in the past six months than Callie had. Bailey questioned if Michelle would ask about it if Arizona were a man. Bailey said every emergency surgery was Arizona saving someone else's baby.

The next day, Michelle questioned Meredith about Sofia's friendship with Zola and her relationship to Penny. She said Sofia loves Penny. She takes easily to people if they're good people. [[Lucinda Gamble|Lucinda]] then questioned her about Meredith and Callie helping each other out. Lucinda emphasized that Callie had a support system in Seattle.

Next, Lucinda talked to Richard about his relationship with Arizona. He said Sofia would be lucky to have her as a role model parent. Michelle then questioned him about their trivia nights. She found documentation from the bar that said they'd won trivia night  times in the last six months.  nights Arizona was out with him, away from Sofia. Richard said he didn't know where Sofia was during those nights. Michelle presented transcripts of text messages between Callie and Arizona showing  times Arizona asked Callie to switch days with Sofia. Lucinda requested a recess.

Michelle questioned Callie about the day Sofia was born. She talked about the accident and how she wanted to give up, but couldn't because she was pregnant with Sofia at the time. She said being a mother was the reason she's alive today.

Finally, Michelle questioned Arizona about the circumstances of Sofia's conception in relation to her relationship with Callie. She insinuated that Arizona had come around later. Arizona said she legally adopted Sofia and that when the time had come to make a choice, she had chosen motherhood and it was the best choice she ever made. During this time, her phone started ringing repeatedly. She told the judge she was a doctor and needed to check her phone. When she saw it was a patient emergency, she apologized, but said she needed to leave. She loved Sofia and wanted her with her, but she knew that no matter what happened, Sofia would he happy and healthy and loved and cared for because she and Callie are her mothers. But there was a kid at the hospital who wouldn't be okay without her, so she needed to go to the hospital to save that kid.

After hearing all the testimonies, Madeline awarded Arizona full custody of Sofia.


She is a judge in [[Seattle]].

{{DEFAULTSORT:Kane, Madeline}}

'''Malar Pascowitz''' is a novelist who ate his own novel, believing it was terrible.


Malar was writing a novel and became so frustrated at how horrible he thought it was that he started eating it. His girlfriend, [[Audrey]], said he got more crazed as he ate more and more of it.

Eating his novel caused a bezoar, which the doctors attempted to relieve with the use of laxatives. When that didn't work, they had to go in surgically to remove it. Before his surgery, Malar was sweating heavily and was anxious. They believed it was solely due to his nerves over the surgery.

Because of his strange behavior, Alex asked if he could keep an extra eye on him. Richard declined his request as they were short-staffed. Despite this, after his surgery, Alex examined him and he was even more delirious. Alex did some research and found out Malar had Mercury poisoning.



He is dating [[Audrey]]. She says they're not married because they can't get married until Malar's book is finished.


He is a novelist.

'''Mary''' is a woman who was treated in the ER after the train crash.


Mary and [[Yvonne]] were traveling together when they were in a train crash. Yvonne seemed okay, but she came to the ER with Mary, who needed stitches for a cut on her forehead. After the cut was stitched, they had to wait for an x-ray to rule out internal injuries before they could leave, so Yvonne settled in next to Mary's bed to wait. Mary's scans came back with just a broken rib, so she was told she'd be given pain killers and then she could go. When Yvonne's phone rang, she appeared to be asleep. When Mary tried to rouse her, she collapsed to the floor. Despite the doctors' best efforts, she died in the ER. She'd been bleeding into her abdomen since her arrival and no one had noticed.



Yvonne and Mary are friends. They were traveling together when their train crashed.

'''Mary Chapman''' is the mother of [[Hunter Chapman]].


Mary's son, Hunter, had been lethargic and irritable, leading her to believe he was doing drugs. She brought him to the clinic for a drug test. [[Alex Karev]] said there were many other reasons that he could have those symptoms, but Hunter's mother asked [[Norman Shales]] to run a drug test, speaking to him as if he were the lead doctor because he was so much older than Alex. The drug screen was negative, so Alex suggested more tests. Hunter then had a bout of dysphasia, intending to say he wanted to go home, but actually speaking gibberish.

Hunter was taken for neuro exams and [[Derek Shepherd]] was called to consult. He had hydrocephalus pressing against Broca's area, which is why it affected his speech. They scheduled surgery to place a shunt.

Before he could have surgery, he collapsed in the clinic due to brain herniation. Derek instructed Alex on how to drain the blood to relieve the pressure. His mom was informed that after he had his surgery, the fluid would drain into his abdomen and he'd be okay.



She brought her son to the clinic because she thought he was doing drugs.

'''Mary May''' is the mother of [[Hayley May]].


Mary came to the hospital with her daughter, Hayley, whom they were trying to commit to the psychiatric ward after she was diagnosed with schizophrenia. When she tried to claw her eyes out, she had to be cleared by surgery first. Alex suspected she didn't actually have schizophrenia and convinced her parents to agree to let him run more tests. He was given four hours to find an alternate diagnosis. He did some research and believed she had superior canal dehiscence syndrome. Her diagnosis was confirmed and she had surgery to repair the defect. The surgery was successful.



She is married to [[Ken May]].


Her daughter, Hayley, was incorrectly diagnosed with schizophrenia.

'''Mason Kiefer''' is the husband of [[Laurie Kiefer]] and father of [[Emma Kiefer|Emma]] and [[Daniel Kiefer]].


Mason and his wife, Laurie, were expecting twins. They decided not to know the sexes of the babies. Laurie went into labor while her OB was on vacation, so [[Arizona Robbins]] stepped in to deliver the babies, but before delivery, she noticed something odd on the ultrasound. She had [[Alex Karev]] paged urgently and delivered the babies, who were both severely jaundiced. The babies were then taken to CT, where it was revealed that each of them had a large liver tumor.

The doctors informed Mason and Laurie of the situation and they decided to be tested to see if either of them was a match and could donate. Mason was a match, but Laurie was not, meaning they could only save one baby. They worried about how they would choose until Alex stepped in and said that they wouldn't have to choose; he'd be making the choice. He ran tests and compared their conditions, but the twins came out tied, so he decided that he needed to open both of them up and look directly at their tumors before he could make the choice. After the twins were opened, he evaluated each of them again and decided that Emma had a better chance, so she received the liver, while he tried resecting Daniel's tumor. Emma immediately started to improve after her surgery, but Daniel unfortunately died during his.



He is married to [[Laurie Kiefer]]. Together, they have two children.


His twin children, Emma and Daniel, were both born with aggressive liver tumors. He matched as a donor, but was only able to donate to one, so Emma got a portion of his liver while Daniel died.

'''Matt Smithson''' is the father of [[Jessica Smithson]].


Matt was at the hospital with his daughter, Jessica, who had Tay-Sachs. She was nearing the end of her life and he didn't want to accept that, so he spent the day trying to put together the money to get her to Mexico for an experimental treatment. At the end of the day, Bailey finally got him to accept that Jessica was going to die and he held her while she went.



Matt's daughter had Tay-Sachs and had lived to the age of six. Desperate to save her, he scrambled around, trying to get her to Mexico for an experimental treatment, but he ultimately accepted that she was going to die and held her while she went.

'''Mel Barnett'''\uais an [[Attending|attending]] [[Pediatric Surgery|pediatric surgeon]].



Dr. Barnett was hired by\ua[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital|Seattle Grace Mercy West]]\uato run the [[Pediatric Surgery|peds ward]] while\ua[[Arizona Robbins]]\uawas recovering from her leg amputation. He came to Seattle from Miami.

Dr. Barnett was introduced to Derek and Callie by Owen. When Callie introduced herself, Dr. Barnett said he was sorry about [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]]. Owen then quickly left to show Mel the [[Neonatal Intensive Care Unit|NICU]] as he felt it was getting hard for Callie. ''("[[Going, Going, Gone]]")''


While talking to Alex about the African program, Mel revealed that Owen told him that Arizona really liked Alex. When Alex told him he was leaving that night for\ua[[Johns Hopkins Hospital|Johns Hopkins]], Mel said that that was a great program. Alex then asked him if Owen informed him on the African orphans exchange program. Barnett said it was admirable work, but that it didn't fit with his agenda. However, he said to Alex that the program would continue to exist, but at another hospital. ''("[[Going, Going, Gone]]")''


At some point, Mel decided that everyone working in [[Pediatric Surgery|peds]] had to create new computer passwords. However, Alex was having trouble with it, saying you had to access the settings menu to create a new password, but that he couldn't access it without any password. ''("[[I Saw Her Standing There]]")''


Dr. Mel Barnett is a [[Pediatric Surgery|pediatric surgery]] [[Attending|attending]].

Mel mentioned that he came from Miami to Seattle when he was hired to work there.


*After his appearance in the\ua[[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|season nine]]\ua[[Going, Going, Gone|premiere]], Dr. Barnett was only briefly mentioned later in\ua[[I Saw Her Standing There]].

'''Michelle Carpio''' is the lawyer Callie hired to represent her at the custody hearing.



Michelle represented [[Callie Torres]] as she attempted to come to an agreement on custody of Sofia without going to trial. They were unable to find a viable solution.


The case went to court, with [[Madeline Kane]] presiding.

First, Michelle questioned Owen about his work with Callie on the veterans. He said Callie was a very empathetic person. He said he didn't feel the move was sudden for Callie, because when she's presented with a challenge, she faces it.

The next person called was Andrew, who talked about living with Sofia and Arizona. He said Sofia made the house happy.

After Andrew, Penny was called. She was asked if she loved Sofia. She said she did, despite only knowing her for a few months. Despite not being able to recall what grade Sofia was in or what she'd been wearing that morning, she demontrasted knowledge of Sofia's likes and dislikes.

When they recessed, Michelle acknowledged that Penny's testimony went poorly, but she was confident the next day would go better. She wanted to put Meredith on the stand last, feeling it would give them a good ending.

Michelle questioned Bailey about the differences between Arizona and Callie's work and their schedules. She presented documentation that Arizona did more emergency surgeries in the past six months than Callie had. Bailey questioned if Michelle would ask about it if Arizona were a man. Bailey said every emergency surgery was Arizona saving someone else's baby.

The next day, Michelle questioned Meredith about Sofia's friendship with Zola and her relationship to Penny. She said Sofia loves Penny. She takes easily to people if they're good people. [[Lucinda Gamble|Lucinda]] then questioned her about Meredith and Callie helping each other out. Lucinda emphasized that Callie had a support system in Seattle.

Next, Lucinda talked to Richard about his relationship with Arizona. He said Sofia would be lucky to have her as a role model parent. Michelle then questioned him about their trivia nights. She found documentation from the bar that said they'd won trivia night  times in the last six months.  nights Arizona was out with him, away from Sofia. Richard said he didn't know where Sofia was during those nights. Michelle presented transcripts of text messages between Callie and Arizona showing  times Arizona asked Callie to switch days with Sofia. Lucinda requested a recess.

Michelle questioned Callie about the day Sofia was born. She talked about the accident and how she wanted to give up, but couldn't because she was pregnant with Sofia at the time. She said being a mother was the reason she's alive today.

Finally, Michelle questioned Arizona about the circumstances of Sofia's conception in relation to her relationship with Callie. She insinuated that Arizona had come around later. Arizona said she legally adopted Sofia and that when the time had come to make a choice, she had chosen motherhood and it was the best choice she ever made. During this time, her phone started ringing repeatedly. She told the judge she was a doctor and needed to check her phone. When she saw it was a patient emergency, she apologized, but said she needed to leave. She loved Sofia and wanted her with her, but she knew that no matter what happened, Sofia would he happy and healthy and loved and cared for because she and Callie are her mothers. But there was a kid at the hospital who wouldn't be okay without her, so she needed to go to the hospital to save that kid.

The hearing ended with Arizona being awarded full custody of Sofia.


She is a lawyer.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Carpio, Michelle}}

'''Mindy Gruberman''' is the mother of [[Seth Gruberman]].


Mindy came into the hospital with her son, Seth, who had gynecomastia and wanted to have surgery. Mindy was nervous about the surgery. While Seth was having surgical guidelines drawn, Mindy decided that she wasn't going to let him have the surgery. Just as she was preparing to have him discharged, [[Alex Karev]] spoke to her and convinced her that Seth needed the surgery before high school because the condition wasn't going away and he would continue to get bullied. She relented and let Seth have his surgery. She was worried while he was in surgery and relieved when he woke up afterward.



She is married. Her husband has gynecomastia.


Mindy's son, Seth, had gynecomastia. He had surgery to remove the excess breast tissue. She was worried about him and relieved when he was okay afterward.

|count =

}}
'''Morgan Peterson''' is a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|intern]] at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].



Alex enlisted Morgan to make study cards for him to practice for his oral boards. While he was doing an endoscopy, she continued to quiz him. But while she was quizzing him, she began to experience symptoms which she described to him. He diagnosed the problem, not realizing that she was talking about herself until she collapsed.

An OB resident told her that her baby was fine and Morgan had a cardiac workup. Alex determined that she was having a heart attack and he paged Teddy. Teddy came in and said that the heart attack happened because she had a spontaneous coronary artery dissection, probably related to her pregnancy.

When [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]] entered the room, Morgan panicked, asking why she was there if her baby was okay. Morgan was told that in order to repair her heart, they had to deliver her baby. Morgan was panicked because she was only at  weeks. Arizona reassured her, saying that [[Sofia Robbin Sloan Torres|her own baby]] was born at  weeks, so she knows it's scary, but they will be there for her every step of the way. Morgan asked someone to call her boyfriend.

Morgan's surgery was hard, but successful. She woke up after surgery and Alex gave her an update on her son and her own condition. ''("[[Have You Seen Me Lately?]]")''


Not long after his birth, [[Chris (If Only You Were Lonely)|Chris]] arrived in Seattle. While Morgan was optimistic about the baby's odds, Chris was very pessimistic, pointing out that he only had a % chance of survival. When Arizona asked them about how aggressive they wanted to be with their treatment, Morgan wanted to be aggressive, but Chris wanted to stop. She eventually gave Chris an out, which he took, leaving Morgan alone to support Tommy. ''("[[If Only You Were Lonely]]")''

Morgan was worried when Tommy developed a brain bleed and needed surgery for his heart. However, the surgery went well despite his bleed worsening and he was stable in the NICU afterward. ''("[[One Step Too Far]]")''

Tommy's condition continued to deteriorate and Morgan had to make a decision again for whether or not she wanted to continue care. She went to Alex for advice, but he felt that they were getting too close, so he had himself taken off the page. Morgan decided to have Arizona operate again despite Tommy's poor prognosis. However, she requested that Alex not be a part of the surgical team. ''("[[The Lion Sleeps Tonight]]")''

When almost all of Tommy's bowel died, Arizona told Morgan that it was time to say goodbye. Alex disconnected all of Tommy's machines and allowed Morgan to hold him and sat with her while he died. After he stopped breathing, she became upset and cried, saying she wasn't ready yet. ''("[[Moment of Truth]]")''



She had a boyfriend, [[Chris (If Only You Were Lonely)|Chris]], but they broke up when he decided to leave their premature son to go back to his job in Cleveland. ''("[[If Only You Were Lonely]]")''


Morgan bonded with Alex while he was treating her son. He stayed with her overnight and she quizzed him to prepare for his board. ''("[[One Step Too Far]]")''

While he was working on Tommy's case, Alex Karev became close to Morgan, to the point where he took himself off Tommy's case because he was worried that Morgan was getting too close to him. ''("[[The Lion Sleeps Tonight]]")''

He later left his boards to come back to [[Seattle]] so he could sit with Morgan as she held Tommy while he died. ''("[[Moment of Truth]]")''


She was a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|intern]] at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].

Mr. Baker was in the hospital with his wife, Allison, who was in Derek's Alzheimer's trial. He'd been working very hard to take care of his wife, which led to his son, Kyle, having a bump on his neck that hadn't been checked out. The bump was found to be a cystic hygroma that was cutting off his airway, which he needed surgery to remove. Allison also had her surgery, in which she was selected to receive the active agent.



He is married to [[Allison Baker]].


He felt guilty because his son, Kyle, had a cystic hygroma that was blocking off his airway and he hadn't gotten him checked out.

{{Patient Infobox
|image = Mr.Bosson.png
|name = Mr. Bosson
|status = Alive
|marital = [[Mrs. Bosson]] ''(wife)''
|children = [[Lori Bosson]]
|only appearance = [[One Step Too Far]]
|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Charles Emmett]]
}}
'''Mr. Bosson''' is the father of [[Lori Bosson]].



Mr. Bosson's daughter, Lori, was admitted to SGMW to have surgery to drain a cyst on her brain. Derek also found a tumor, but decided to leave it as it was not causing Lori any problems and could be removed at a later date if needed.

Having been on Derek's service for some time, Derek assigned Lexie the task of draining the cyst. Having left Derek's service following her tampering with his clinic trial, Derek had forgiven Meredith and invited her back to work with him again in neurosurgery and wanted her on Lori\us procedure.

Under Derek's supervision, Lexie performed the craniotomy and cyst drainage perfectly. However Derek got called away by Alex for a consultation on [[Morgan Peterson|Intern Morgan\us]] premature baby, leaving Meredith and Lexie alone with Lori. After noticing some bleeding, Meredith instructed Lexie to enlarge the craniotomy to find the source. Upon finding the source of the bleed and cauterizing it, they uncovered the site of the tumor. The tumor had clear margins and its removal appeared straightforward. Despite Meredith having doubts that they should remove it without Derek knowing, she eventually prompted Lexie to remove it. After they had finished, Meredith went to find Derek and reported what they had done and that it had went well. Instead of being pleased, Derek was furious, saying that Lori had not consented to tumor removal.

Meredith reassured Derek that Lori would be fine. Upon waking up from the surgery, she was responsive to visual stimuli. However, when she tried to speak, she could do little more than make terrified groans. Derek diagnosed Lori as suffering from Aphasia, a condition in which a patient can understand speech and form sentences in their brain, but renders them unable to physically form words. This was due to the fact that 'Broca's Area' in Lori's brain had been damaged by the tumor removal and was ultimately irreversible. Despite Meredith protesting that she had told Lexie to remove the tumor and that it was her fault, Derek took responsibility. Lori's parents said that they were going to sue him.

Upon hearing of Lori's condition, Lexie was devastated. Meredith comforted her saying that she had to go and see Derek who would be very angry and would yell and scream. However, she would take it in and never make a mistake like that again.



He is married to [[Mrs. Bosson]]. They have one daughter together.


His daughter, Lori, had surgery to drain a cyst. While she was in surgery, they also removed a benign tumor, which ultimately caused aphasia, leaving her unable to speak properly. He and his wife declared their intent to sue Derek over what happened.


*He and his wife were in Rome when they heard about Lori's condition.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Bosson, Mr.}}

'''Mr. Burton''' is the father of [[Jake Burton]].


His son, Jake, was born with craniodiaphyseal dysplasia.

Jake was admitted to the hospital after complaining of headaches and nausea. Scans revealed that he had a brain tumor, because the growths had turned inward.

While Derek planned the tumor resection, Mark proposed a plan to remove the growths from the outside of Jake's skull, giving him a more normal appearance. Derek was against the idea, but Jake wanted the surgery. After convincing his parents, they signed the consent so he could have the surgery. They planned to do both procedures under the same round of anesthesia to make things easier on Jake's body.

Jake died during the tumor resection, but Alex and Cristina had the idea that Mark could still fix his face for his parents. After he was done, Jake's parents came in to see his body and cried.



He is married to [[Mrs. Burton]]. Together, they have one son.


His son, Jake, was born with a condition that caused tumors to grow all over his face. When he was , he had a brain tumor that required surgery. When he died during that surgery, she was devastated.

'''Mr. Nyles''' is the husband of [[Anna Nyles]].


Mr. Nyles came into the hospital with his wife when she was scheduled to have a mastectomy to treat her breast cancer. When his wife became distant and started talking about not having the mastectomy, he became concerned. He asked Bailey to talk to Anna, but Bailey had been accused of being too emotional with patients and declined, saying it wasn't her place. However, when he became even more concerned about his wife not wanting to fight the cancer at all, he went to Bailey again.

Bailey talked to Anna and then watched Gus while his parents talked. She said they were leaning toward the mastectomy.



He is married to [[Anna Nyles]].


He has one son, Gus. He was concerned when Anna refused to hold Gus while she was hospitalized. When he mentioned that Gus wasn't taking the bottle well after Anna had to quit breastfeeding, Bailey suggested that he try a little bit of sugar water on the tip just until he got used to it. Mr. Nyles said it worked well.

'''Mr. Verma''' is the father of [[Nicole Verma]].


Mr. Verma's daughter, Nicole, was paralyzed from the waist down. She was admitted to the hospital when she had spasms that caused her legs to jerk involuntarily and she needed a procedure to control the pain. During the consult, Derek asked if she'd considered a cystoplasty, which would enlarge her bladder and create a stoma, negating the need for a catheter and giving her more independence. Her mother was reluctant and said she didn't need it.

Because Nicole was , under the guise of getting more tests, Derek had Alex take Nicole on a walk without her parents. He talked to her while they were walking and she eventually decided she wanted the surgery even though her mother didn't want it.



He is married to [[Elaine Verma]]. They have one child together.


He and his wife are very protective of their only child, Nicole. However, he was more willing to loosen the reins than his wife.

'''Mr. Weston''' is the father of [[Brian Weston]].



When Brian was , he booked an appointment with [[Alex Karev]] to find out how old he had to be to start his sex reassignment. Alex referred him to a transgender support group, where he met [[Jess (The Face of Change)|Jess]].

At , Brian came back to the hospital after saving up for the last four years to have his breasts removed. Jess came to the hospital to support him. On the other hand, Mr. Weston was highly unsupportive and felt that Brian would change his mind.

The surgery went well. Jess talked to Mr. Weston afterward and admitted that she had sent the e-mail informing him about the surgery because she believed he should know. He offered her all the money he had on him to help out with their rent, but left without speaking to Brian.



He did not support Brian's decision to have his breasts removed. While talking to [[Jess (The Face of Change)|Jess]], he repeatedly misgendered his son.

'''Mrs. Sims''' is the mother of [[Tyler Sims]] who was born with an encephalocele.


Her son, Tyler, was in the hospital after being born with an encephalocele. Before Tyler's surgery, [[Arizona Robbins]] reassured his parents, saying that she wasn't worried at all about it.

After the surgery, Tyler's parents were pleased with the result. They were informed that he'd be left with only a small scar on his forehead.



She is married to [[Mr. Sims]]. Together, the have a son, [[Tyler Sims|Tyler]].


Her son, Tyler, was born with an encephalocele. He had surged to have it removed.

'''Naomi Evans''' is the estranged wife of\ua[[James Evans]],\ua[[Alex Karev|Alex Karev's]]\uafather.



After James ended up in a coma in the ICU, Alex called Naomi and told her that James had died. He asked her to come over. She booked herself a ticket and left [[Nicky Evans]]\uain Florida, because she felt that there was no reason to bring him.\uaWhen she arrived at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], she immediately recognized Alex as being James's son. He took her to the ICU, where she discovered that Alex had lied to her as James was still alive, albeit hooked up to machines and dying. Alex told her that James would die in a few days, but Naomi didn't really care about James, still angry over how he left her and her son. She only cared about her father's guitar, which James took with him when he left. She retrieved the guitar and left.



She was married to [[James Evans]]. They were together for five years. They separated after he abandoned her and their son, but never legally divorced.


Her father left her three guitars when he died. Jimmy pawned two of them and took the third when he left her.


*Naomi is Japanese.

'''Nash''' is a kid who came into the ER after hurting his arm.


Nash came into the ER with an injured arm after climbing a bookshelf. Alex ran x-rays, which showed no breaks. Nash had a sling and was told to listen to his grandma the next time she says not to climb the bookshelves.



Nash's grandmother brought him to the ER after he fell while climbing bookshelves. While she was there, she tried to set up Nash's mother with Alex.

'''Nathan Englander''' is a child who broke his femur.


Nathan broke his femur. His parents took him to an after-hours clinic, where the break was misdiagnosed. He was sent home without any pain medication and was up all night. The morning after, his pediatrician sent his family to the ER, where they waited several hours for Nathan to be seen because he needed to be put under anesthesia to get a cast on his broken leg as well as one on the other leg to keep the break stable so it would heal properly. At  PM, he was finally taken into surgery to have his casts placed. He chose the color blue for his casts.



Nathan's parents both came to the ER with him. They were worried about his leg and upset with how long it took to get him care.


*His mother calls him Monkey.
*His favorite color is blue.

'''Nico''' is the boyfriend of [[Clementine]].


Nico came into the ER with his girlfriend, Clementine, who had an allergic reaction after eating peanut clusters Nico had given for Valentine's Day. Alex gave her a breathing treatment and IV medication for the rash.

When Clem had a more severe reaction, Alex had to give her epinephrine. Clem later went into anaphylactic shock and had to be intubated. Alex said they'd need to keep her overnight to watch her.

After his mother insisted that they go home, Nico threw a fit and refused to leave as he'd promised Clem that he'd stay. Alex came out and told him that he'd give Clem a message so that Nico and his mother could go home.

Alex read Clem the note, which read,

''"Dear Clementine,''

''I'm really sorry you're sick, but I'm not sorry you're my girlfriend. It's the worst, being alone on Valentine's Day, but I'm thinking about you right now. I'm thinking about holding hands with you and jumping on the trampoline together. I love you. And P.S. I don't care who gave who lice. I'm just glad we both had it together.''

''Love, Nico"''



He is dating [[Clementine]], a fellow  year old. They like to hold hands and jump on the trampoline together. They had previously had lice at the same time.


Nico's mother drove him over to Clem's house to deliver a box of chocolates she had purchased for Clem and then drove them both to the ER when Clem had an allergic reaction. When she tried to make Nico go home later that evening, he refused, saying he promised not to leave Clem.


*He was  years old on Valentine's Day .

[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] |first appearance = [[I Must Have Lost It on the Wind]] |last appearance = [[Cold as Ice]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Geena Davis]] }} {{Quote|And you think ''I'' am? You think this is easy for me? You think I'm ready? I was fine. I got fine with dying. And then you infected me with your stupid--with Shepherd and her plan and your stupid hope. And now, it's harder than ever to hand all this over. I don't want to. I'm scared to. And I'm scared to let go of it, and it's all your fault, so... I think the very least you can do is deserve it. Take over, do well, make me not regret it. Can you do that? Please?|'''Nicole Herman''' to '''[[Arizona Robbins]]'''}} '''Nicole Herman''' was the [[Attending#Department Head|Head]] of [[Fetal Surgery]]\uaat [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. Dr. Nicole Herman was first seen when she talked to Arizona about a shared patient. She repaired the U.T.O. at weeks and when she went to check on the baby, the parents could not stop singing the praises of Arizona, while she only did a few little stitches when the baby hit the air. Nicole brought up the open fellowship spot and suggested that Arizona should apply so that she could learn something that's actually hard, rather than taking the credit for other people's hard work. Arizona objected that she too did really hard things in peds, but Nicole wasn't convinced.\ua''("[[I Must Have Lost It on the Wind]]")'' When Arizona started her fellowship, Nicole immediately began assigning extra research and work to her. When she struggled to keep up, Nicole reminded her that everything in the womb happens at super-speed, so she needs to learn to keep up. ''("[[Got to Be Real]]")'' Nicole continued teaching Arizona and an OB/GYN resident,\ua[[Graham Maddox|Dr. Graham Maddox]],\uain a very strict and severe manner. She noted Arizona's impeccable record and good relationship with her peers, but treated her strictly as her fellow, for example not letting her join in on a personal conversation. She granted Arizona the chance to perform a solo fetal surgery, but upon noticing Arizona wasn't as well prepared as she expected her to be, she gave the opportunity to Graham. She later took Arizona aside and informed her that she was letting her down, causing her to start doubting Arizona's operating skills and even her own teaching skills. Herman told her that if she messed up again, she would fire her as her fellow as she did not have the time to wait for Arizona to catch up.\ua''("[[Bend & Break]]")'' Nicole told Arizona that she had an inoperable brain tumor and only had six months left to live. She wanted to use this period of time to teach Arizona about Fetal Surgery since it is a new field and all the knowledge she held wasn't found in any textbooks. ''("[[Don't Let's Start]]")'' After telling Arizona about the tumor, she left it up to Arizona to decide if she wanted to continue to learn from her or if she wanted to turn her into the board, which would mean that the fellowship would go away. While Arizona was trying to decide, Herman left her in charge of the department as she had an appointment. At the end of the day, Herman returned to the hospital. She noted that Arizona had done exactly what she should have done in Herman's absence and confessed that she'd been getting radiation therapy. After this, Arizona agreed that she wouldn't tell the rest of the board and would continue to learn from Herman. ''("[[Could We Start Again, Please?]]")'' When Amelia informed her that she believed she could remove the tumor, Herman initially rejected the idea, because she'd been given hope many times before and then had it taken away. However, after Arizona confronted her and said that she was throwing away a chance that [[April Kepner|April]] and [[Jackson Avery|Jackson]] would love to have for their baby, she relented and agreed to hear Amelia's plan. After hearing it, she agreed to have the surgery, but only after the tumor grew as large as it could get and still be removed in its entirety. She insisted on that even when Amelia insisted that it needed to be removed as soon as possible. ''("[[Where Do We Go From Here]]")'' While Amelia developed her surgical plan, Herman created an intense crash course intended to teach Arizona as much as possible in the time they had left. ''("[[The Bed's Too Big Without You]]")'' Herman and Arizona continued their crash course over the next four weeks. However, earlier than they expected, Herman started to experience fuzziness at the edges of her vision. An MRI revealed that the tumor had invaded her optic chiasm, meaning it was time for her surgery. She was taken immediately to the OR and sedated for surgery. ''("[[Staring at the End]]")'' Amelia operated and despite some complications, she successfully removed Nicole's tumor. However, she didn't wake up for several days after the surgery, leading Amelia to look for a cause. An MRI showed signs of a stroke and Amelia worried she'd never wake up. Despite this, she did eventually wake up. She was fully aware of her surroundings and showed no loss of mental faculties, but she was completely blind. She told Arizona that she was grateful that she got to figure out what was next for her because Arizona pushed so hard to get her to have the surgery. ''("[[The Distance]]")'' After being discharged from the hospital, Herman went to the Blind Institute, where she learned to live her daily life as a blind person. She sent Arizona a text that said, "Enjoying Blind Institute. Learning how to not bump into things. Not typing this obvi. Don't kill any babies." ''("[[I Feel the Earth Move]]")'' After finishing "Blind School," Nicole went dark over the loss of her ability to do surgery, to save lives. Then she looked at all the things Arizona was doing and realized she could teach and that could matter. She could save even more babies that way. ''("[[Cold as Ice]]")'' Nicole returned to Seattle when she had a series of headaches over a month. Amelia worried that her tumor had returned, even after a CT looked clear. However, she ordered a spinal tap to rule out CSF leak. After the tap instead confirmed it, Amelia said she'd need a shunt, but Amelia didn't want to do the surgery herself, because she had operated on Nicole before under the influence of a tumor. Nicole revealed that she knew about the tumor because of [[Tom Koracick]] and still wanted Amelia to do the surgery. ''("[[Cold as Ice]]")'' Ex-Husband She was married but is now divorced. She mentions that while they were married, she was involved in many boards and committees, things that were important to him. She quit all that later because it wasn't important to her. [[Tom Koracick]] After becoming blind, she had sex with Tom. She said that sex when you're blind is even better. ''("[[Cold as Ice]]")'' [[Arizona Robbins]] She seems to have had a rather close professional relationship with Arizona Robbins, teasing her about the fact that fetal surgery is even harder than pediatric surgery. However, when they began working together more closely, they bonded and became more friendly, with Arizona even spending several nights in the hospital with Herman, who was staying there during their crash course. After Nicole left to go to what she called "Blind School," she lost contact with Arizona, though she continued to follow Arizona's professional work. They made up when Nicole returned to the hospital and offered to use her grant money to open a center for women's health with Arizona. ''("[[Cold as Ice]]")'' [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] She and Amelia were shown discussing [[Addison Forbes Montgomery|Dr. Addison Montgomery]]'s new life as a mother, indicating they know each other both personally and professionally. Both practice the surgical specialty of [[Maternal-Fetal Medicine|maternal-fetal medicine]] and are renowned in [[Fetal Surgery|fetal surgery]]. [[Graham Maddox]] While he was rounding on her service, she started a sexual relationship with Graham. She said he was a nominal surgeon and a complete tool, but was a satisfactory sexual partner. Dr. Nicole Herman was the\ua[[Attending#Department Head|Head]]\uaof\ua[[Fetal Surgery]]\uaat\ua[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. After an\ua[[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]]\ua[[Resident|residency]], she completed a\ua[[Maternal-Fetal Medicine|maternal-fetal medicine]]\ua[[Fellow|fellowship]]\uaand eventually sub-specialized in\ua[[Fetal Surgery|fetal surgery]], a brand new field of medicine that she's basically inventing as she operates. One of the few fetal surgeons in America, Nicole trained\ua[[Arizona Robbins|Dr. Arizona Robbins]]\uaas her fetal fellow, and\uaOB/GYN resident [[Graham Maddox|Dr. Graham Maddox]] who regularly rounded\uaon her service. Her excellent reputation as a fetal surgeon\uamade [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] the go-to hospital for fetal surgeries in the Pacific Northwest. After she became blind following the surgery to remove her brain tumor, Nicole was left unable to operate and resigned. After leaving surgery, she got a faculty position at UCSF, teaching fetal surgery. She got a grant from HHS and decided to use it to open a center for women's health along with Arizona, saying she could teach and Arizona could perform fetal surgery and make the country safer for women and babies. ''("[[Cold as Ice]]")'' *She is the first known\ua[[Fetal Surgery|fetal surgeon]]\uawho's part of the staff of Grey Sloan Memorial. It's been since\ua[[Addison Forbes Montgomery]]\uaworked at Seattle Grace Hospital that a fetal surgeon part of the hospital's staff was shown, as [[Emma Marling|other fetal surgeons]] were only visiting. *She is the fourth hospital staff member to suffer from cancer, being preceded by\ua[[Elizabeth Fallon]], [[Richard Webber]], and\ua[[Izzie Stevens]]. *When [[Emma Marling]] turned down the [[Two Against One|open maternal-fetal surgeon position]], it may be that Herman was hired instead. *Herman wore a personalized scrub cap that was gray themed with black leopard spots. xNicoleHerman.png|[[I Must Have Lost It on the Wind]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[Got to Be Real]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[Bend & Break]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[Don't Let's Start]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[Could We Start Again, Please?]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[Risk]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[Where Do We Go From Here]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[The Bed's Too Big Without You]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[All I Could Do Was Cry]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[The Great Pretender]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[Staring at the End]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[The Distance]] xNicoleHerman.png|[[Cold as Ice]] x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg {{Nicole Herman Appearances}}[[de:Nicole Herman]] [[fr:Nicole Herman]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Herman, Nicole}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (Oncology)]] [[Category:Patients (Neuro)]]

'''Nicole Verma''' is a patient who was paralyzed from the waist down.


Nicole was paralyzed from the waist down. She was admitted to the hospital when she had spasms that caused her legs to jerk involuntarily and she needed a procedure to control the pain. During the consult, Derek asked if she'd considered a cystoplasty, which would enlarge her bladder and create a stoma, negating the need for a catheter and giving her more independence. Her mother was reluctant and said she didn't need it.

Because Nicole was , under the guise of getting more tests, Derek had Alex take Nicole on a walk without her parents. He talked to her while they were walking and she eventually decided she wanted the surgery even though her mother didn't want it.



While she was walking with Alex, she asked him to kiss her. He leaned in like he was going to, but instead, he told her that she didn't want her first kiss to be like that.


Nicole is very close to her parents because she isn't able to be very independent from them. Despite this, she went against her mother's wishes and decided she wanted the cystoplasty.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.
*She's homeschooled.
*She was starting college at Seattle Community in the fall.

'''Noah''' is a kid who collapsed at the zoo after a cyst on his liver ruptured.


Noah came into the ER with his mother after collapsing in pain at the zoo. [[Arizona Robbins]] did an ultrasound and a CT. She also started him on antibiotics for the sepsis. He was found to have a cyst on his liver, which ruptured when his mother hugged him really hard. Noah started coding, so they rushed him into surgery. The cyst was so large that they had to remove his gallbladder as well.

His surgery went well and his parents were told he'd be fine. It was possible he'd develop more cysts in the future, but at least they knew now.



His parents were concerned about him when he was in the hospital and worried about the possibility of another cyst rupturing in the future.


*He likes to wrestle.

'''Noah''' is the driver's ed teacher of [[Arvin]] and [[Rhys]]. He's also dating Rhys's mother.


Noah was teaching Arvin and Rhys to drive when Rhys passed out twice. Noah had Arvin take them the hospital, where Rhys was found to have an infection his throat. Rhys's mother, whom Noah was dating, arrived shortly thereafter. Rhys had told Noah that his mother always talked about breaking up with Noah. They argued over Noah's lack of ambition, though Noah says he saves lives by teaching new drivers. Despite Rhys's mom saying he could leave, Noah stayed at the hospital until he knew Rhys was okay. After Rhys's surgery, they were told they probably wouldn't have been successful if he'd come in any later. Rhys's mother said Noah saved his life and kissed him.



He is dating Rhys's mother, though she contemplated breaking up with him frequently. However, after Rhys's surgery, she said Noah had saved his life and kissed him.


He encouraged Rhys to think of him like a father, though Rhys didn't.


He teaches driver's ed.

'''Norman Russo''' is an OB/GYN at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


When [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]] had to go to court for her custody hearing, Russo took over caring for [[Jennifer Parker]], who had fallen while  weeks pregnant. He placed a plasma patch to repair an amniotic fluid leak and then observed her overnight. When her condition didn't improve, he planned to do a c-section. However, after he'd made the incision, Arizona stepped in and took over, dismissing Russo from the OR.


He is an [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


*According to Arizona, he can be old school.
*Russo is one of the few [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] [[Attending|attendings]] who opt to wear navy scrubs instead of the department pink normally seen on other staff OB/GYN attendings.
